column2:
It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends  
passed and went to secondary school. In class I was always  
getting more marks than they did.
Being alone in the room at night.

When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my  
other friends and me.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does  
not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me  
by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with  
both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and  
would like me to be close only to her.

I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion  
after an accident.

When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though,  
when he was sick.

I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment  
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed  
holiday job.

I once felt that my last hour had come when I was unexpectedly found  
in the hands of.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't  
the slightest grounds for it.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there  
was a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at our  
door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.
Had fear of losing husband.

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it  
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until  
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives  
were brought to my knowledge later.

One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to play  
with them outside and to catch some boys.  However our parents  
did not know that we were out and when I got home it was very  
late and I feared being scolded by my parents.
One of my best friends was hurt by a girl he loves.

I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our  
holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to  
see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get  
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there,  
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a  
wonderful time all day long.

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked  
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded  
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust  
saddned me.

When I "passed out" a female friend of mine for no apparent  
reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like  
that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation.

Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character -  
gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of  
the life-saving dogs.
Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and I  
gave the wrong answer.

Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the  
Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he  
took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something  
in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who  
accompanied us.
My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did  
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said  
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see  
her. Later she saw me and said hi.

Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him  
home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that  
the one I had was out of date.

Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two  
Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences  
of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with  
friends and sometimes not even going to school.
I realized the girl liked to be with me.

The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I  
experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran  
away from the course.
Quarrel in the family.

I wrote a letter to my father to ventilate my bottled up  
feelings. Afterwards I thought it was too negative.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told  
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This  
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

I felt disgust when I kissed a guy that I know. I was on the outs  
with my boyfriend and this person appeared but he has nothing to  
do with me.

I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was  
thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely  
away.
[ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]

When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major  
operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a  
relative she had no relatives in N.Z.

I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing  
money.

During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me  
outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain  
hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the  
circumstances

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had  
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night  
out in 20 years.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.
When my brother gave me a watch.
A bad smelling cucumber.

When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home  
because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a  
man. But it remained undone.

I feel disgusted at not having got aa "A" in yesterday's  
practicals of G220.

In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by  
laughing.

Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time came  
when dad joined the family from his working place I found myself  
having fear for him for no cause at all.

When I learnt that I had failed an exam,  This not only influenced  
my emotions but also other important tasks, it also made my  
record imperfect.

Before the certificate examination I was very poor in Biology  
(the worst result in my class).  Ever since F.5 it had been  
getting poorer and poorer.  I had tried my best and had spent  
most of my time studying this subject.  Finally my results were  
so bad that I thought that it was just not fair.

I told my parents (or more realistically) would not do what they  
wanted me to do anymore. I guess I sort of betrayed them after  
all they had done for me.

For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among  
people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a  
wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and  
miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it  
would be to be her in the same situation.

I was with my boyfriend forgetting that I had left the house  
unlocked. Unfortunatly a thief came and stole all the kitchen  
utensils. Thereafter I was afraid of the consequences.

In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hitting  
close by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid I  
might be struck.
When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.
Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.

I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs,  
and drawers.

When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really  
bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted  
my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I   
would succeed or not.

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the  
death of my father.

My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick  
him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a  
stranger.

When I was young my mother told the neighbour that I had wet the  
bed.  I felt ashamed thinking that the neighbour's children would  
get to know about it.

Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men  
committing various acts.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because  
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of  
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same  
way.

A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many  
friends were present and good music.

There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives  
in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I  
accused him of several things.

Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we  
started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of  
interest in knowing personal details and then they started  
talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little  
interest in those activities so I talked to another student  
sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me  
questions on those activities.
When my child was born.

I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very  
startled then and wet my pants.

I had not done my assignment seriously.  I only pretended to  
finish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.  The  
whole thing made me feel guilty.
My good friend misunderstood me.
Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.

I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying  
for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a  
serious illness, even death.

When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people  
jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were  
shouting something at the same time.

Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is  
something I just can not tolerate.
When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about  
me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends  
with my boyfriend's other girl.
When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
[ When I feel that I have made a mistake.]
When a class-mate died.
I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

When I could not attend the college picnic due to some  
difficulties.
Not being able to hand in homework in time.

My 80 year old grandfather underwent three successive operations  
during a single year.  The third operation was risky and I was  
scared that he would die and feared that my grandmother would be  
very sad.
Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close  
- I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted  
violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.

We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The  
teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did  
not own up so the  whole class was punished.
Finding out China is backward in science.

I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and  
education.  I said something and then realized that I did not  
know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt  
ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything  
about.

After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too  
personal.

The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my  
boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with  
my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt,  
then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the  
strongest.

Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as  
everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their  
room.

In neglecting some work that had to be done around the house and  
telling my roommate I would get it done.

When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a  
period in which he felt very depressive.
When I fell down.

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody  
took it seriously but I got frightened.

Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I  
broke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.

The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing  
accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the  
house.

When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents  
also informed.

A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it  
back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed  
me and was run over and killed by a car.

When my son fell off the cot at the age of 5 months, I became  
very nervous and thought that it would cause defects in his head.
When my father passed away.

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me  
and I did not know who they were.

When my father banned me from going to his sister's home due to  
some misunderstanding between the two.

After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ?  
crying and upset.

When I get an exam back with a grade that I did not desire. Then  
I get mad at myself and say that I could have done better.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a  
form.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong  
moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an  
extremely positive word).

I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother came  
to drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin his  
friends. I was embarrassed because the family involved was  
extremely nice, and hospitable to him.
Saw a dead rat on the street.

I had asked the teacher to write a recommendation letter for me,  
but I had not provided enough information and had run short of  
time.

In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During the  
fight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came back  
next day.
Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.
Could not help a student who needs help.
My roommate messing up our room.

Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and  
take the blame for any mistakes.

I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at  
a distance of about four metres.

A few weeks ago I thought about an exam I had to take soon. I  
remembered this just before I had to go to sleep. I felt guilt  
because at the beginning of the year I planned to succeed.
I offended my mother.

When I have seen people very drunk and making fools of  
themselves.

I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see  
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting  
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a   
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I  
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found  
him.

This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was  
brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.
When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had  
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of  
the night and shouted at me.
I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt  
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be  
in order.
When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
[ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]

When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never  
thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt  
ashamed of myself.
Not applicable to myself.

People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke".  
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even  
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to  
the situation.

I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying  
to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of  
materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play  
fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.   
Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was  
intense.

I once saw an elderly lady who was not properly dressed.  She was  
wearing a transparent dress, such things are not sopposed to be  
seen in African society.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction  
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

At secondary school, one of my classmates lost her locker key.   
During a class I saw two other classmates holding a key and  
talking secretly.  I do not know why I suspected them, also  
another classmate supported me.  He remembers that these people  
had only one key in the key-ring, this had seemed strange to him.  
 Besides another classmate said that he had seen them selling  
books at a book-shop and they should not have had such books.  I  
told the teacher and the person was caught.  He had sold the  
books and was forced to quit school.  I found that I had not  
helped him as he stole later on also.  I felt guilty

It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia  
and that she would never come back.
Finding out that a boy I do not like is in love with me.

When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love  
with me, rather bluntly four times.

When I was a child, one day while playing, I fell up to my waist  
in mud.

Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated  
physically me and my mother.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm  
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had  
behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made  
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the  
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks  
forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on  
"Mummy's day") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family  
more important than grandfather ?

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not  
expected.

My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who  
made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful  
future, who made me dream.
When my mother kept me in leading-strings.

The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was  
very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going  
to crush me.

A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He  
tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk  
too much.

I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad  
language but was a very smart looking lady.

While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting  
helplessly.

Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey  
my own thoughts and feelings.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one  
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon  
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted  
by a friend.

When a member of the family complains about the food that is  
served, it disgusts me.

At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a  
friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.

When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have  
been right.

I was once called in court in Zemba Traditional court to answer a  
charge of impregnanting a young lady, I felt guilty for she had  
some letters which I used to write her as an exhibit in court.

When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by  
having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times  
after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.
Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.

All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did  
not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number  
but I do not think that this was true.

When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult  
operation.

Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had  
abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very  
angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse  
so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.

I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was  
impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense  
of guilt.

[ When I break someone's things out of carelessness, or do something   
to make others feel unhappy  or hurt the self-esteem / self-confidence   
of others, especially if they happen to be friends or family members.]

A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were  
late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I  
know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that  
particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it  
anyway (i.e. being late).
Someone told me we are not as good as the All English Class.

After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes  
and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my  
roomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt for  
moving out for the bad reasons.

One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of  
brances, which was not the wind.

I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away  
untimely at home.

I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the  
car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.

I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours.  
For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very  
important for me.
When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.
Being told that I am a stupid person.

At about nine p.m., I went home by bike on a dark cycle-track;  
because of lack of time I had to take the short-cut.
A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.

When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught  
me with them in my bag.

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent  
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about  
something.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted  
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him  
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had  
hurt him so much.

I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I  
received a score below the average and I thought I had done very  
well.

I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two  
points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I  
swam in, and thus my team won the championship.

While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt  
scared and fled to the bathroom.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.
When my grandfather died.

When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting  
changes in my life, and I became happy.

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying  
colours and that I had made it to the university.

I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going  
to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the  
state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students  
can find an appartment.

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the          
primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.   
Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really  
evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and  
angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.

Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous  
when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I  
had thrown away some clothes and food.

South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more  
than China).

When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the  
match.

Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the  
motorway on my motorcycle.

Once in primary five, I had forgotten to take a book to class and  
the teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of the  
class.  I thought about the way my mother would react if she saw  
me being punished.  My mother was very good to me and though she  
did not see me punished, I felt sorry for her.

I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then  
the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt  
really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was  
something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.
When my daughter was born.
When my sister was born.

Being insulted in front of my parents, and they believed other  
people (those insulting me).

When I was a student at the Institute doing my M.Phil degree, one  
of my professors called me before the convocation and told me  
"You have got the gold-medal (first rank) in the university and  
tomorrow you will be on T.V".

Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes,  
without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw  
the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really  
liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for  
me.

I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)  
as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed  
money from my purse.
When I met my boyfriend with another girl.
Not finishing homework in time.
Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would  
be definately selected to the university of Zambia.
My teacher's death.
Finding out I am not good looking.

I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular  
job was not done, it was not my job to do it.
Broken a friend's cup.
Before the first examn.

Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed  
terribly.

It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me  
and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have  
never seen anything like that before.
When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.

When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the  
yard.

I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, while  
playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch  
was difficult.

Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without my  
consent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying to  
find a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.
Being put down by the class leaders.
When ditched - divorced by husband.

I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express  
himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.

An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to  
me.

When I knew that my niece did a bad schoolar examination because  
I couldn't explain her the lesson.
Not getting an airplane ticket fot my mother.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.

I loved a person and he went away. It wasn't necessary that he  
left me to reach his goals.

I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by  
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly  
small distance.

When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the  
U.E.F.A cup.

When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her  
boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole  
thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He  
embarassed me in front of a crowd.

I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against  
a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the  
headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.
I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.

When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about  
something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed  
had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my  
sense of shame.

At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was  
prevented from participating in several activities.

In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I  
was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His  
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I  
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few  
days later he died.

I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was  
waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the  
operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me  
the date in passing.

I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole  
week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers  
thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to  
observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice  
to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had  
given me.

After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key  
inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own  
house but the house of people I hardly knew.
When I told my girlfriend a joke openly and frankly.
Not doing well in the examn.
When in my childhood we were forced to take cod-liver oil.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study  
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance  
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

When I received the acceptance form for the second year at  
university.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his  
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping  
from under my feet.

I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  
 attend the class she took a few minutes later.

When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was  
very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.

When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I  
felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the  
person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this  
without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as  
she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I  
felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought,  
NOW I would not have done it.

When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to  
approach me.
I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.

I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I  
did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt  
while he was playing.

A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had  
already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it  
again.
Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).

I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long  
period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night  
together.
The death of an animal we had reared.

My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at  
night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect  
darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to  
surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later  
accepted.

When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock.  
 I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the  
gallows.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very  
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed  
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So  
I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very  
sad about this.
When I won my car.
When my grandfather died.
Finding out that life span in China is shorter than in the West.

I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had  
left me.

When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and  
my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol).  
Disgusting he'd better be a stallion.

I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and no  
one liked the meal that day.

I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics.  
Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and  
started to cry. I grew angry.
[ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]
Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.
When I got accepted to CAL.

When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was  
moonlight.
When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.

When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me,  
because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it  
wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke  
because of a certain end.
The sight of vomit on the street.

When I was 12 years old I was caught by the Ticket Collector when  
travelling without a ticket.

One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship  
had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would  
fade.
On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with  
giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove  
it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed  
in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a  
boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The  
paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this  
cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great  
discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said  
that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this  
situation, and of the persons implicated in it.

When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he  
had just repaired.

At the crowded conditions of living.  I always quarrel with my  
elder brother as he puts the T.V volume at a deafening level and  
I can not practise my piano lessons.  Thus I feel that my home is  
disgusting.

A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married  
here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my  
parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.
Being close to drowning.

I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father.  
When I went home he was at work.
Failing examn.

I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left  
the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that  
sloppiness and impudence.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her  
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking  
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and  
encounter.

I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School.  
When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out  
of 80 students hence I felt joy.

When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend  
of mine.
In the morning just before going to the dentist.
NO RESPONSE.
I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.

Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age  
will go to your English lectures and they do not understand  
English.

That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with  
priviledge. Not using it positively.
When my mother had a nervous illness.

When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the  
change to buy wine.

When my boyfriend told me that it would be difficult for him to  
marry me.

When I realized that the person I was courting hadn't been really  
by my side for a long time already. He had deceived me and I let  
him deceive me.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he  
didn't come.

As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more  
anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My  
heart was full of joy.
I gave a wrong answer at school.
Going to see a good film with my best friend.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of  
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as  
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be  
right are concerned.

I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very  
fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By  
chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

After the interview for admission to the university and before  
the admission list was disclosed.  I was scared that I would not  
be admitted and my fear lasted for quite some time.  My fear  
disappeared only after the list was disclosed.

When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane  
was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that  
we were going to crash.

Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not  
understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation.  
I was very afraid to fail.

My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed  
at night.

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother  
became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and  
lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our  
rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually  
died.

When  first came to CAL I went to a rally on Sproul and I later  
learned that the rally was conducted by the Moonie cult. They  
were taking pictures at the rally, so I was afraid that they  
would circulate the pictures and then kidnap people. I did not  
know how the cult worked. I was scared.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in  
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of  
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my  
colleagues.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go  
there, if I wished, in Summer.

[ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the  
person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood  
and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]

When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought  
that he had told about it to a friend of his.
When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.

My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something.  
 In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I  
realized that what she had done had been for my good.

I just opened the bathroom without knocking not knowing that  
someone was bathing inside, it happened to be my father.

A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the  
worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the  
reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being  
given the runaround.

I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends to  
have a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with each  
other.

I'm allergic to most foods - eating something that I'm allergic  
to caused guilt.

A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend  
although I did not know his family.

When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little  
food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited  
us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with  
old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans,  
and dishes, and even the food.

To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the  
circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps  
because it has been one of the good things that I learned with  
this friend.

I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well.  
( I had not seen her for several months.)
Got a big fish in fishing.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate  
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5  
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.
Watching a horror movie with friends.

Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a  
forest and I was going alone.

After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half  
a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for  
economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his  
friends and that he was dead.
A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking  
place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming  
traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed  
his car on the place.

I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very  
romantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with the  
lights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.

The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the  
final at Athens.

My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two  
days after.

I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings  
in public, because other people do not understand my reactions  
and think that I am silly.

This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops  
were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water  
in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the  
conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours  
after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time  
and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.
Death of a close friend.

When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was  
16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short  
time.

My classmate always borrowed my notes and would not return it to  
me on time.  When I had a test she was selfish and irresponsible  
and so delayed my studies.
Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.

I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad  
for a long period.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.

Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly  
the use of another person.
The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to  
clean up the dish later.

Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain  
papers.

I trusted a friend of mine, but she lied to me about something  
and this disgusted me.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. He  
said to me "Hello darling" I was terrified and imagined the  
wildest scenes.

I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very  
disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it.  
(Later on it proved that this was his intention).
In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.

Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering  
some very cruel and sharp words.

A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but  
negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to  
express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him,  
I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but  
still I do so.
The passing away of my mum.
When I got separated from the woman I loved.

My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it  
meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.

When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of  
Psychology.

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very  
good and we were very satisfied.

At a private party I literally fell into the food. The party was  
completely ruined for the host, carpets had to be cleaned, etc.

Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for  
11 years (I had stayed down due to illness)

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it  
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think  
I can call it so.

I entered the hostel this year.  My mother was ill and could not  
move and needed people to look after her.  Every week I left home  
to go back to school, I felt guilty.

When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the  
Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.

When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two  
children differently.

After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he  
had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.

Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people  
challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were  
drunk.
That I would do bad in a class and not get into Bus school.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous  
for me and the people close to me.

[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.   
Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being  
here on earth.]

I was together with my family one night, a few days after my  
father had died, during that conversation I expressed my  
displeasure because nobody understands me.

At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad  
as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at  
university, although I had been appointed to formally oppose the  
paper which was being presented.

Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -  
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done  
a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

I was reading in the paper the feature on Henry Lucas who claims  
to have killed 380 people. He was a recreational killer and a  
necrophiliac and zoophiliac. He has raped and beaten many women  
and killed men too.

While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death,  
threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight.   I met a  
vile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me  
till I got up, then he got angry.
When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.

When my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying  
to break into his house.

Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between  
OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish  
title.

I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which  
we created ourselves.

When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care).  
I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months  
pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made  
me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would  
probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a  
long time.

When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person  
(my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't help  
me.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my  
lover and future wife.

As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an  
examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer  
time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my  
car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I  
passed my last exam.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.   
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things  
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and  
make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the  
prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.
People who discriminate other people disgust me.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot  
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a  
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses  
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck  
and it was a real adventure.

When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and  
looking down on me.

I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I  
found that the bed had been wet the previous night.

I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he  
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
When I think about my parents getting old.

When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his  
younger brother.

Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger  
woman, beating her up.
Not included on questionnaire.

My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very  
close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought  
one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that  
we have a great new design - it's always the same.
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his  
other activities.  We both play in different bands and rehearse  
in my parents garage.

When taking part in the mobbing of one of my best friends in  
primary school.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was  
very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

When my cousin's wife refused him sex and claimed that she was my  
girllfriend.  I think that there is something wrong with the  
woman as I have never even thought of having sex with her.

The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the  
classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

I had a quarrel with near persons. I said many ill-considered  
things and I regretted it when it was to late.
Did not finish homework.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied  
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had  
done nothing.

When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other  
people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.

I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not  
expected this so I was very happy.
Relatives visiting me.
When I was accused of something I had not done.
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted  
to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how  
things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it  
was really good - though really insane conversation.

My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.   
I felt sad about the coming several years.

Realizing that school will soon be over, and we will all go  
different ways, perhaps never meeting again our friends from this  
year.

I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the  
fright and because I was nervous.
One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.

When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due  
at 1400 hours.

When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and  
then I heard unexplainable noises.

When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at  
all.

The first time that I saw a dead person.  This was when I started  
my gross anatomy practicals.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years,  
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been  
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes  
me feel really sad.

I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my  
fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for  
my ex-boyfriend.
First day at University (I didn't know what to expect).

I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk  
about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They  
try to repress it.

After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very        
badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had   
gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry.  
She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly,  
I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.
When another person's mother died.

My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write  
letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good  
relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he  
loved me.

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while  
I thought she was in love with me.

I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I  
heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to  
attend a wedding ceremony.

We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him  
and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do  
it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I  
told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he  
excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt  
embarassed.
NO RESPONSE.
When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it  
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his  
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it  
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the  
preceding week.

When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I  
always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth  
place.

I had taken the responsibility to do something and I had  
prepared for it.  However I failed because of my timidity.  After  
three attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere and  
failed as before.  I felt imcompetent and felt that the others  
would think that I had not prepared for it.

When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other  
feelings.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to  
justify a wrong action.
Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a  
Christian.

I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called  
my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling  
disappeared I felt ashamed.

I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know  
each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.
When I was a school girl and I copied at a class work.

A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to  
the university.
Disappointment over a friend.

When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  
 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been  
waiting to see us.

When my father (physically handicapped) asks me to do something  
and I raise several objections. Often I can fix it in few  
moments.
When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.
When I made an end on a relationship after three years.

When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stopped  
working.
A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.

When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to  
university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the  
requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I  
would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial  
insecurity.

When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed of  
going to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had  
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I  
ran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and she  
told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.

I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a  
big dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.  I had to eat it.

When I was giving private tutorials to my student; he would not  
concentrate and was lazy.  He had not done the home work that I   
had assigned and his academic level was very low.  It was a  
nuisance.

When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University -  
it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.
Getting lost in a strange place.
As a child, when I saw an "unesthetic" sight.

I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my  
friends.

When I had to lie to my boyfriend so that he wouldn't suspect I'd  
bought him a xmas present as expensive as I had.

When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just  
come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe  
which I opened and was overcome with joy.
When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.

My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I  
misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On  
realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in  
the sand.

Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this  
is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.   
However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.   
This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student  
lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened  
to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about  
twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing  
me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really  
paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.
Not being able to argue against class leaders.
At the death of a close relative.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted  
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly  
assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The  
discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation  
was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to  
present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was  
very poor.  I really felt ashamed.

In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position  
to advance his own interests.

When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.   
She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish  
thing to do.

A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on  
holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go  
on holiday.

I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal  
diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who  
deserves high respect.

When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous  
language of Maori at an important function where I was the only  
woman in the group and it was expected of me.

While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up  
very well and they made a remark about it.

One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because  
he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I  
went to see him the following morning, the place was really a  
mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.

I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and   
my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.  I tried  
to make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listen  
to me and insisted that I go out with her.  I find it unnecessary   
to talk to her anymore.

When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited  
economically.
At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.
Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.

I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was  
supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I  
fixed the tire. After fixing the tire, the salesperson who helped  
me was gone so I walked out of the store without paying. I felt  
guilty so I went inside and paid for the tire.
When I passed a very important exam.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.

When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was  
wrong.

I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do,  
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits  
that get me mad.

When I was travelling to school by bus, I went past a place  
where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell  
which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.

Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend  
then over me.

I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's  
grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was  
my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.

I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the  
runway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilot  
suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an  
obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show  
signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on  
the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question  
so that everyone starts to laugh.

When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I  
fear that something will happen to the baby.

Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from  
boarding school on accrediting leave.

After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy  
was very sad about this.

When I provoked a fight with my mother, hurting her feelings very  
much.
Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).
Not finishing homework.

I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I  
had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had  
expected.

When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a  
car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits  
and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this  
conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I  
had anticipated.

I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say  
something.  It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situation  
for me.

When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teacher  
nor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.

When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had  
ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not  
 understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

My mother revealed personal details about me and the  
negative aspects of my character to other people when I was  
present but unable to defend myself.

I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show  
rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.   
I felt frustation - bordering on anger.

When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.  She does  
not trust me and constantly misunderstands me.  I get  
particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend  
with whom she works.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She  
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of  
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.
When I saw an insect going up my arm.
When my father died.

I was of the opinion that 12.00 pm was too early to be back at  
home after going out, so I stayed away longer, knowing that my  
mother would be worried.

I was not prepared for the exam but I wanted to sleep the night  
before the exam.

During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School  
had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche  
Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked  
my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good  
reason. I felt very angry with her.

One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying  
to kiss me.

When there was a bomb threat in Tolman Hall. This was the first  
time that I felt my life could be in danger.

[ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one  
thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another  
person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]

When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him  
understand I felt miserable.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a  
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned  
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had  
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got  
furious.

After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and  
felt guilty about having taken it.

Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. With  
my help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in the  
mood to help him.

My fiancT's family was adopting a 5 years old boy. I felt  
myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his  
mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send  
him back.

We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)     
staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started  
passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was  
brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was  
herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks  
made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly  
remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the   
guy.

When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age  
of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the  
funeral: I sat on the table and cried.

Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which  
revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had  
thought possible.
When I try to lie.

The trick was really intolerable.  They hid it, and I was worried  
and restless all day.  When I saw them I really wanted to slap  
each one of them.

My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would  
find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's  
room.
Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.
Being insulted by my roommate (she is in the English Class).

My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth.  
 One day my friend went off to another booth to play.  This  
meant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.  His  
behaviour disgusted me.

A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central  
underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers  
who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexual  
encounters, while I held a vision of having a deepening  
above-board (you know, "girl next door") devotion to a girl in my  
head. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently I  
felt disgusted at my failure.

I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My  
friend relied on them.

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone -  
loneliness drains me.

I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not  
tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but  
understanding. We talked the whole thing over.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part  
very well but did not know the second part.

The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I  
loved so much got married to another man before a rebuff from  
her.

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of  
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We  
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar  
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if  
I would succeed as a group leader.

The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my  
sorority which I did because I was ashamed.

A few days after I had finished the relationship with my  
boyfriend, we had a quarrel. Then he hit me. At that moment I  
found him disgusting.

When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after  
I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower.  
 She left and I had to do without supper.

Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to  
that class.

Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle -  
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
Falling in love.

Some boys told me your nickname is "Little Girl Doctor", I did  
not tell them off and laughed with them.
Caused a family disturbance.
The same as in SHAME.

I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a  
little cup. There was a thick white "wad" in it. I tried to take  
it out and throw it in the sink.

When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting  
foolishly and playing dangerously.

The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor  
said that the ear was completely all right.
Death of the family dog.

I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was full  
of lamps in it.
When I forgot the lines of the play during an orientation camp.

In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I  
had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people  
were in the kitchen.

Our class had organized a picnic in November.  I was the class  
representative so I became the organizor.  However the picnic  
was postponed by one week and I had something else to do then.  
Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go for  
the picnic.  When I had the time to think about it I thought that  
my decision was wrong.  My classmates thought that I would go as  
I had signed my name but I did not go.  I told another class  
representative that I was not going but he did not know the  
reason behind my not going.  After the picnic my classmates asked  
me why I had not gone to the picnic and everytime someone  
mentioned it I was apologetic.  I should have decided right in  
the begining that I would not go and then they would not see me  
as irresponsible i.e promising to go and changing my mind  
afterwards.

When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third  
time.

When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something  
you have striven to.
When the contract about my shop was signed.

A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I  
was able to break loose.

When my brother-in-law's brother stole my clothes when my  
brother-in-law and I had gone to cut wood for the fire.

When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong  
manner.

When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at  
secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.

My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I  
had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day  
enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.
When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.

I felt ashamed of feeling sorry about myself when I passed  
through the situation of being betrayed by my girlfriend.

Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was  
behind by 3 games. We won the last set 6-2 and won the match by a  
game.

When my flatmate put me down because she "thought" she was better  
than me, or she felt she was.

I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay  
program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the  
program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt  
very sad.

Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was  
directly involved in it.

I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house  
for one month.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it  
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it  
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people -  
friends who I love and respect.

When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it  
and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to  
continue at college.  I did overreact.

I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next  
to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to  
join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started  
looking at me and I had to move to their table.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I  
am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury.  
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again.  
When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out  
again and put the butter into the pan.

When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I  
was unable to see this person because of the situation.

When I was emotionally unstable I said things which may have hurt  
others or made them feel unhappy.  When I calmed down I realized  
that I had been selfish and had not taken into consideration the  
feelings of others.  Then I felt ashamed as someone pointed out my  
behaviour to me.

I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting  
protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas  
submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother  
screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another  
person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.

When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me  
on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of  
property.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an  
hour for the next one.

Fear of the turn that the examination paper would take as I  
lacked confidence.

Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were out  
after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.
I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bath tub.
Once when I crossed the street, and was nearly trampled by a car.
Passed an exam by 2 points.

During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's  
comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large  
audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot  
my text.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera  
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of  
an important felow while at the same time some young and able  
singers work in a quite different field of life.
When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.
Being caught in changing the truth (lying).

Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth  
year twice.

A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her  
that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that  
course."  She just shows off in front of other people.

My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed  
there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.
When people around me did not understand me the right way.

When I realized that not all my friends like the comments that I  
pass in their presence.

In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as  
I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load  
on the tractor trailer.

A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got  
sick.

In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and  
afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I  
answered more carefully.
Hearing my girlfriend accept my offer of marriage.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt  
the other person very much.

To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor  
people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly  
kept.

When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to  
jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that  
I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig  
happened I felt ashamed.

Finding out that my health condition may be against my attending  
university lectures.

When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on it  
proves that he didn't do anything wrong.
When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.
Having a fight with a class mate.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back  
home, I felt very sad.]

When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too  
much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.

When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people  
killing each other.

I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress  
award, while our play got the first place.
[ No description.]

When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who  
had been murdered by terrible methods.

A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad  
when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had  
once regarded as great and significant.

While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on  
his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him  
permanent injury.

Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings,  
I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.
When my mother was robbed in a shop.
