When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an  
audiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.

In an examination ,which other students found easy I could hardly  
think and did not know what to answer.

I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through no  
fault of mine.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by  
insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in  
front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in  
order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to  
calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger  
we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

On Reberbahn, I was in a "restaurant" where drinks were  
overpriced.  I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and when  
the bill came I could not pay the bill.

I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping         
with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very   
sudden to me.
Friend's fiancT left her for me.

In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a  
crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was  
prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also  
antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.

When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused  
because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my  
boyfriend found out.

I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while  
in a position of trust.

At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I  
wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told  
me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.

A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did  
not dare to speak out.

When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't an  
excuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe I  
made.

This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life  
in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three  
men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were  
beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets  
and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to  
myself -"what is life?".  It is one hell of a place where  
everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of  
the other one just for a living, (money).  When I think about  
such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and  
dejected.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

A situation where we were the center of attention, and things  
happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement,  
and ignorance.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine  
abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I  
have attempted, but have not actually gone through with  
corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill  
for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.
When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.

The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on  
holiday.

Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically  
beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.

When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a  
nonacademic degree.
I had to change a baby's clothes for the first time.

We where in a bar and my friend had a fight with some guys who  
were in the table aside.

I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At  
the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the  
hell of a noise.

At end of school - function to "celebrate" ? Leaving friends who  
I'd known for up to 12 years.

I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't  
know why.

[ When family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not  
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace  
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves  
that I have fallen in love with him.

I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someone  
already was sleeping.

When an intimate friend of mine passed B.A with first class and I  
got only pass class.

I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two  
afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the  
presence of my friends.
I had worries about a certain illness.
Cueing for bath for a long time.

Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and I  
was trying to protect my brother but the other man was calling  
names to both of us.
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a  
holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken  
a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we  
got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest  
and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there  
for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know  
that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the  
superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do  
it himself since he was quicker at it.

When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator  
in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the  
drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

At a party, several comments were made about the personal  
situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected  
and uncomfortable.
I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.
Selling my used car.

We always made a lot of noise during a certain lecture.  This may  
have been because we did not respect the lecturer. Finaly, the  
lecturer could not tolerate it and he scolded us angrily and  
pointed out our misbehaviour.

A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the  
morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the  
evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

A children's film in which I played a clown, with spotlights,  
cameras and the director who demanded jumps and guffaws.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was  
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.   
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a first  
division.  I had been thinking that I had not done very well.
I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.
When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last  
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of  
3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded  
pass).

I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place,  
particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had  
left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on  
the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.

I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them  
that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but  
she didn't stop me.

When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I  
could have avoided.

When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I  
thought "This is my end, I am going to die".

I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I  
lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of  
trouble.

I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog  
ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very  
startled and terribly upset.

While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong  
that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and  
got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but  
they didn't show up.

I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speak  
to my relatives and  friends.  Because of this feeling I would  
avoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.

My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into the  
party.

We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to  
swerve and we almost got run over.

I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my  
birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.

I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That  
appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long  
time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the  
departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped  
and fell.

When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel  
angry.

This happened when I could not get into the school I had  
initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never  
thought I would do.

I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quite  
unexpected.

I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a  
song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both  
the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.
When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.

I felt guilty one day when I was accused of running away from  
classes and I was caught.

Against the will and without the approval of my parents I went  
for a few days to my boyfriend in Germany.
Not doing well in the examn.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue  
duty as a soldier.
A gang of screaming and drunk youths "captured" a tram.
Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.

A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort of  
volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to  
send me out and the address was very far especially on foot and  
turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.

I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in  
getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I  
felt I had lied to them.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing  
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it  
deep into her hand.

Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed  
at this.
Death of brother.

A story I heard recently about a baby dying after sexual  
abuse.

Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do  
it due to transport troubles.

For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and  
who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.   
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased  
threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when there  
suddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts of  
Africa.

I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and  
everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought  
nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything  
- although I knew how he felt.
Saw some girls dressed up like Americans
I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.

I felt guilty when the truth was known about my impregnating the  
girl we were staying with.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression,  
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the  
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's  
out of me.

I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last  
exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher  
seemed satisfied.

I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our  
flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event  
actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to  
this, she had said nothing.

I received a letter from my college telling me that I would not  
be allowed to sit for the exams because of my low attendance in  
class and the bad experience in the terminal exams.

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many  
friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I  
could have embraced everybody.

When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother's  
dame.

A friend of mine shot himself through the head after having told  
me and others that he would do so.

When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person.  
His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
When I stole something.
When my dad passed away.

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard  
gunshots.
When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy  
studying and concentrating on my classnotes.

I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my  
extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to  
leave their home.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before  
I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my  
father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a  
flood of the same emotion.

When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my  
boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.
As for disgust.

I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one  
of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was  
selected to start Nursing.

When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often  
misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.

I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had  
passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in  
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights.  
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me  
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not  
intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I  
felt responsible for her illness.

During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy  
I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I  
like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........

When I did something naughty and it lead to the embarrassment of  
my parents.
When I went home by train from Sicilia, I was molested by a man.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.

I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just  
suddenly.
My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.
When I met an old schhol friend (school love).
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
Make a mistake, offended my friend.

[ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own  
good.]

I became very angry with my friend because he didn't do shopping,  
while we agreed on him doing this. My being angry was proved to be  
without reason and I felt guilty about it.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I  
most wished, around me.
When I was studying and someone disturbed me.
Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.

I had something wrong, saying wrong things and being impolite to  
someone, and this had embarrassed the this person.  And I  
still meet the person.

When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in  
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I  
was responsible for her.
When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial  
problems.

This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman  
(prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered  
by the guardian.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination  
and was selected for Secondary School.

I felt anger when I had a fight with my father, and he beated me.  
My mother came to help me (because I was beeing beated) and he  
also beated my mother.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.

When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran into  
me.

I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I  
wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.

A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and  
invited me for a party.

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a  
long time.

One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend  
and out of jealousy he started calling me names.

When I began school at UC. The pre-enrollment the classes, and  
the question of success really scared me.

When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former  
secondary school.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud  
band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother,  
right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming -  
probably in pain.

With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk  
which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated).  It took  
a while for the milk to seep through the bun.

Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and  
I had not seen him for 10 years.
I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.

When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her  
feel hurt.

When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular   
remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked  
me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless  
just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to  
getting an A in the class.

I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any  
longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very  
much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely  
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and  
my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.
My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father  
before they briefly separated.
When I found out I got accepted to Berkeley.

My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.   
There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4  
operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

When I contacted a sexually transmitted disease and the  
lecturer came to know about it as it was he who treated me for  
it.

When a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends  
that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful  
to him.
To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.   
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let  
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.
When I went to my first dental appointment.

One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of  
his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of  
myself.
When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.

When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my  
father had brought another woman home while she was away.

My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I would  
even take some money from my parents and brother. She found out  
and yelled at me.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural  
Institute.

I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We were  
at the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After saying  
goodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and  
it was a sad trip home.

When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that  
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views  
about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people,  
had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was  
ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a  
conversation about it with a person.
When I thought the house was on fire at night.
Being slandered by friends.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I  
wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything  
turned out fine.

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That  
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good  
grade for an examination.
When my grandmother died.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted  
as a student in medicine.

When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had  
strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical  
stress.

I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a  
book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely  
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and  
anger.
When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.
About Sweden's arms exports.

I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a  
bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother  
really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.

I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that  
there was no reason for that.

I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was  
bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went  
to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover  
I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally, she  
died.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.

A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.  I was  
one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it.  
 Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time  
that I was seeing a corpse.

In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards I  
paired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacience  
and ridiculous attitude.

When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my  
clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out  
in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents  
discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt  
ashamed.
When I received my promotion letter.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and  
ordered me to give them money or face death.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives  
abroad.

I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much  
money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother  
was better off then me.

I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The  
girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with  
money.

I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board  
exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were  
postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However  
when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored  
less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.

I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.  I was  
afraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me.  
 I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find an  
opportunity to apologize.

I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the  
course.

The hero was chased by a terrible vampire in a suspense and  
horror film shown on T.V.
When I got the first compound through column.

It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am  
familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently  
occurring cause may be described as "the self-assured dullness".

When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was  
meant to be a joke.

When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell  
them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports  
on the radio.

I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past.
REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.

I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I  
failed and so I felt very sad.

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after  
it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt  
guilty.
I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.

When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I  
had learnt all the lines.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.

When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife  
and stole all my money.

In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor,  
near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.

In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed  
copying.

When I was offered a place in the university as a full time  
student.

When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a  
big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.

Sitting in the dorm when the guys were verbally reading letters  
in Penthouse.
I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.
Talking to a close friend.
During a meeting.

I had a class-mate who was rather stupid.  I did not like him  
but I respected him.  When he tried to talk to someone, they  
would not listen to him and I could not bear seeing this.
I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most  
of all when we are at a party.
When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on  
the way home.
Found out my wife is pregnant.

Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every time  
I see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.

Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and  
terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.

Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found  
that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt  
guilty in my heart.

Someone told me I was chosen for the English lectures because I  
am good looking.
A "near-accident" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road.

When I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported  
it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.

When my first sexual intercourse turned out to be a flop.  I was  
in a panic and ended up without an erection.

I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people,  
with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.

Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his  
studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he  
was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also  
because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the  
test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we  
found out that he succeded in entering at the University.

I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red  
handed.  She forgave me later.  I was very ashamed of what I had  
done.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.

As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had  
thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were  
ghosts dancing around me.

When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged -  
although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very  
sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might  
one day reconcile.

The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed,  
hitch-hiking to work.

I was told I shouldn't visit my sister because the holiday was  
short.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving  
me any thing - money to come back to school.
Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.

While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of  
cows.

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For  
tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker  
player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to  
win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been  
necessary.
When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.
My friend who was in the Bago was kicked out of the sorority.

China can not even give you good sound systems for an open  
lecture.

My intimate girlfriend told me that her father was opposed to our  
relationship  and had insulted my integrity.

I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days  
later he died.

I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA  
demonstrations.
I took french leave to do my homework.

I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that  
my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.

I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared  
myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about  
it.
When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.

When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different  
directions.
My parents told me that they do not like my friend.

When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated  
him, and caused a great instability.

My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it,  
and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I  
had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to  
bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that  
I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I  
wasn't able to cook by myself.
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.
I saw a septic, smelling wound.

The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast  
reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home  
and still has 60 kilometers to go.

In the begining of teenage, on the matters of sex - speaking  
about sex.

When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would  
tackle the questions.

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to  
the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
Car accident in the middle of the night.

In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they  
greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the  
wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my  
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly  
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He  
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties  
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help  
me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second  
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. In  
the bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there were  
delicate things.

I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood.  
During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The  
fact of being alone in that house frightened me.
When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
Failed an examn.

Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had  
separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they  
were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being  
alone.

I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the  
people were not advanced.
Insulted by teacher.

I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most  
angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.   
It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in  
class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I  
had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my  
parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.

I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I  
said I had not passed my last exam.

When I got permission to study at a place which was far away from my  
home.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was  
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want  
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way  
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and  
continue my studies.

There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a  
Medical Assistant.

Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my  
morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it  
was too late, however I did realize this.

I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was  
a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had  
arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the  
flat.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a  
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations  
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car  
because of the missing spare parts.
Breaking an implicit promise.

I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man  
appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the  
hold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had never  
seen a gun so close.

I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the  
scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at  
times just plain rude behavior.
After shouting at a friend.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and  
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself  
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties"  
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak  
about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke,  
that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his  
friends, but I was present.
Failing an examination.

Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice  
but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the  
first moment I felt shame, not ache.
On meeting an old friend of mine.

Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an  
awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as  
fast as my legs could carry me.

When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at  
by my parents.

I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love  
with him while I had a close boyfriend.

Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and  
molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did  
not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.
Saw people spitting in public.
My grand father caught me eating his private jelly bean supply.

At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she  
asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp  
remark.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching  
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed  
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would  
require.

When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've  
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,  
and nervous.
Insulted by a teacher in front of the class.

When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw  
that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.

Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and  
later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was  
rude at a certain time.

I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting  
I forgot to take the minutes.

Yesterday I broke my sister's raio. She hears it always when she  
has school examinations and now she has examinations.
Comments from other children on my alcoholic father

When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal  
feelings and then days later changed her mind.
Being chosen to do this experiment.

When I did not defend my close friend when my father degraded  
him. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with his  
actions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter up  
with my father a few weeks later.
Saw a mate bribing the leader.

I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when  
I was trying to propose to her.

I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot  
about it.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal  
tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they  
found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved  
a liar.

When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with  
certain other friends which they thought was improper.

I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in a  
pit-latrine that the little girl fainted.

Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and  
that perosn was negative and pessimistic.
When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.

I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is  
important to our relationship.

I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had  
done something which I really didn't do.

A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to       
see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked  
me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.

We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a  
walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of  
the right way back.
When I won some coins in a small competion.

Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person  
responsible.

I had to leave an important function early because of family  
commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.

One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simple  
question which I could not answer.  Finally the teacher himself  
gave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I had  
not been able to answer a simple question.  I knew the answer but  
feared that my response may be wrong.  All this made me feel  
ashamed of myself.

This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good  
mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor  
to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a  
very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this  
class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got  
into my element and started imitating the professor, and the  
professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was  
unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but  
it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I  
suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her  
entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw  
what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through   
out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the  
fact that she gave me a character certificate.

When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the  
coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I  
thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the  
coffee was undrinkable.

A girl in our class was nicknamed "fatsy". Later, I heard that  
she suffered from diabetes mellitus.
When I could not complete my assignment on time.
A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.
In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.

When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off  
Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and         
splinters of bone every where.

I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to  
illness.
I felt guilty when I lied to my parents.

One of my relatives became seriously ill. I felt sad because I  
didn't know if she will ever be the same again.

I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after  
we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's  
problems.

Walking around the University at night by myself, having been  
previously warned of rapes, etc.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I  
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present  
one with whom things are not much of a success.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is  
not treated decently.
When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.

After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being  
selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.

I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt  
myself very unhappy for a long time.

When I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sad  
end.

My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my  
room while my father explained that the way she saw things was  
not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.

One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men  
molesting my girlfriend and me.

My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and  
disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school  
weakened.

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going  
to separate.
When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.

When there was a possibility of getting on better in professional  
life. I valorized very much this aspect. People showed me this  
possibility, not the real fact (even because until now ...)

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of  
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with  
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk  
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the  
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really  
dependiong on me.

When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I  
was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too  
fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then  
toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no  
consequences.

I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved  
when she said to me that she didn't love me.

[ No answer as I see very little difference between shame and  
guilt.  Therefore see answer for "shame".]
Saw someone spitting in public.

I felt very guilty when I tried to teach swimming to my younger  
brother, as I myself could not swim very well and my brother  
had started sinking to the bottom, however my elder brother  
saved him.

My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I  
felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the  
feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling  
of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.

I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had  
been admitted to the university.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with  
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked  
in me many negative emotions.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to  
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded  
by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and  
was saved only by the appearance of other people.

I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start  
studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam  
this time.
T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.

Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was so  
angry.  She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did not  
know what to do .

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary  
school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.   
The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel  
us.

When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me  
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was  
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am,  
bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and  
in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to  
really hurt her.

When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would  
have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the  
letter.

Some students have been calling lecturers nicknames and I was not  
able to find out who they were to stop them.
A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.

Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of  
sadness.

When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I  
had fear that I might be one of the failures.
Could not find my way out in the college building at night.

I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly  
disregarded.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second  
birthday.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and  
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and  
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad  
about that.

In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came  
in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while  
I was trying to concentrate on the program.

I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day,  
my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could  
influence my parents to take it easy.
When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.
Forgot to collect post for a friend.
Almost had a bicycle accident.

When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices,  
which my father also adheres.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known  
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.

When I knew almost the same day about two great friends of mine  
that had serious existential crisis, and mainly when I notice  
that I'm in the same situation that they are, but I didn't  
realize it.

Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has  
happened many times.

This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal  
and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was  
contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her  
response.
Watching suffering in Third World country.

After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,  
who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.

A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few  
months old.
Late for a lecture and therefore missed it.

One camping night, I listened to the ghost stories told by my  
classmates.

I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence  
when  a train was coming.
I am not doing what I should with this questionnaire.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set  
quite involuntarily.

After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very  
happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.

When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came  
to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously  
met.

The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice is  
so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical,  
irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.

I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road  
with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we    
saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do  
anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have  
any legs.

When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not  
reciprocated.

After the accident which I described in SHAME. I came to myself  
and saw how terrible everything looked like. I disgusted myself  
and everything I saw.

I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my  
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.
When I got my drivers licence.
When my cousin passed away.

Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though  
there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it  
had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me  
as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend's  
parents to meet them.

I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all over  
his clean clothes.

During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of  
taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the  
university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for  
the petrol.

When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It  
wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I  
felt very guilty.

When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I  
feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of  
the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is  
aware that I know that they are wrong.

When I cheated my trusting girlfriend by telling her that I was a  
qualified doctor and later she found out that I was only a  
medical student at the preclinical level.

My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at  
night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing  
several things. So we don't see each other often.
When my girlfriend became pregnant.

When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock  
in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the  
barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my      
own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there  
were ghosts in that area.

We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors  
left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to  
prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum  
down my throat.
When our dog died.

When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the  
outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and  
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it  
rolled by and hit me.

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was  
sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think  
was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water  
it seemed like no one would care or remember.
My fiancT left me for my best friend.

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and  
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and  
used it for her business without my knowledge.

We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following  
us.

I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced  
sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not  
selected for Secondary School education in 1978.

While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable  
situation for those who were with her.

When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor  
balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to  
the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost  
his balance when he sat down.
Every time I see a spider or a snake.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I  
always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my  
mother. So my mother always scolded her.

My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it  
for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and  
when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.

Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital  
after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his  
guts when he was still alive.

I dreamed that this girl and I were cuddling in bed when my  
girlfriend walked in. I really love my girlfriend so I felt  
guilty and sad. I know that this is a wierd example but the dream  
and the feeling was clear to me as if it had really happened.
When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former  
one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know  
that I almost had full marks.

New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my  
partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little  
opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated  
and my boyfriend's parents were present.

That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my  
brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and  
two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital  
 to see my brother.
The loss of my mother.

I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was  
the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in love  
with an uneducated girl.

When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the  
term by one point.  The fact that exactly the same thing had  
happened last term did not help.

When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after  
having  gone to a disco without permission.

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was  
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate  
woke me up.

Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well  
together, we dislike each other.

I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone  
houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have  
much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen  
them before) and there were several inches of clear water on  
which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the  
short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the  
plants to death.  My friend said "They will not die" and I sat  
down happily and my trousers did not get wet.

I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering  
me.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I  
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were  
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less  
good time.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years,  
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal  
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a  
bit guilty for what had happened.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.
My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.

I found a problem in homework which would not get solved although  
I tried my best.

After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to  
relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had  
finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I  
was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

Once I was not able to give a relative, who was in a critical  
period, a helping hand.  Whenever I think about it I feel guilty   
for letting down the person who trusted me to give him a helping  
hand.

We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact  
plans to paint my room without consulting me.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept  
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a  
half.

At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an  
apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky  
would like this).

One of my good friends told people something I had told her  
in confidence about someone else.

I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without  
permission and I was found guilty.
When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.

I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead  
father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was  
innocent and I felt guilty.

I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off  
I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him  
with no excuse to do so.

I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in  
order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress.  
 I sold my friend, I was despicable.
I was misbehaving in the agency.

I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut  
above his left eye while trying to separate us.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus,  
by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit  
outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as  
to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was  
terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported  
him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.   
I was even more petrified then.

I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a  
car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and  
stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went  
on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a  
garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home  
terribly afraid.

I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against the  
wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had  
been angry after my mother said something to me about not being  
able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive  
about. (6' 5'' 210)

This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home,  
I was very hungry a few hours before supper.
A lie on the part of a person close to me.

I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship  
with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.

My parents appreciate very much me and my boyfriend coming and  
have dinner with them at Christmas. However we decided to visit  
his parents. My mother was rather disappointed.

While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and  
right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair  
lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to  
creak loudly.

I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like  
me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career  
but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got  
me a three day furlough.

When my roommate and I had dinner together we decided as to who  
would clean the bowls.  One day when I came back from school I  
found that she had not cleaned up.  Since I had to cook dinner I  
cleaned them myself and felt unhappy and disgusted.

Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and  
felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed  
person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having  
given her this additonal problem.
I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.

I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain  
girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing  
them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt  
guilty.
When somebody made me touch human faeces.

I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended  
love and affection to be able to sleep with her.
When my dress was stolen.

When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to  
work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts  
him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.

A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not  
even think about me when she did not need me.

Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importance  
to the receiver.

Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my  
parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was  
afraid that he would report to my parents.
Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.

A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay  
only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't  
leave and I was very angry.
Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).

During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I had  
reported that I was late.  I pretended that I had but looking at  
her eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.  I thought that  
it was really bad luck that she had examined the list of the  
students who were late.

I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough,  
and was told that my work was not up to standard.

My friend did not do well in the examn because I did not help  
him.

When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university  
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand  
into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came  
to report to my parents.
Finding out I am not chosen for the English lectures.

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to   
the cold weather.

A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebody  
cared.
Anger towards my lover for being late.

When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian  
soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the  
whole scene.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long  
time.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of  
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at  
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been  
drinking.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of  
a rat.

When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should  
do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped.  
Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

In the last day of carnaval I met a boy and began to flirt with  
him. I was in love with him. When he introduced me to his friends  
I died of shame because I was with them before, I met my  
boyfriend in carnaval.

On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a  
bird.(swans of the bay)

When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and  
there was a lot at stake.

I encouraged my brother to play football and he was hurt while  
playing the game.
Not collecting letters for my friend al I promised.

I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things  
more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very  
self-centered.

My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a  
peculiar manner.

I was ashamed at myself for having shouted at my daughter because  
of my marital break-up and the unfair way I was treated.

When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after all  
of us, all by herself.

I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship  
between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I  
moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard  
and didn't previously know about I suspect.

I once felt guilty when a certain passenger in the same (ship,  
plane ?) which I boarded when coming from home lost his 10t which  
in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.
The first time I left home.
The birth of my daughter.
When I had a serious argument with a dear person.

I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons landed on  
my rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.

Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be  
perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I  
realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against  
both girls.

I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist  
championship, and so it lost the classifications.

I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago,  
however, I fooled around with my roommate, and didn't start  
studying until 12:00 am. I was disgusted with myself.

I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I  
was the quietest girl in class.

While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell  
although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
I didn't attend lectures.

I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working  
hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and  
I was guilty-conscious.

When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama  
competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which  
lasted for several days.

I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that  
didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the  
attacked person bleeded to much.

When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did  
not know what would happen.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).
Not giving up something for Lent.

I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It  
went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are  
not my favorite spots in life.
When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making  
noise in class.

My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having  
lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had  
been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.

I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had  
enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.
A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).

I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government  
offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for  
it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor  
error.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not  
enough space to store them.

My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I  
had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me.  
Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on  
my birthday two weeks later.
China cannot buy your reference.

I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain  
man. I felt anger.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.

The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I found  
that she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the same  
room there were some women visitors with children so the room was  
smelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stay  
any longer.

[ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the above  
stated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

Leaving the house myself and a female friend had shared for 6-8  
months because of the friendship which developed and our approach  
to each other in occasional instances of several personal crises.

When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be  
hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong.  
Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to  
cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid  
listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.

I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking,  
along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband  
was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.
Staying alone in a dark place.

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from  
what I was told about it.

I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I  
could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.
Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the  
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had  
thought.

I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the  
money last term.

As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback.  When the  
atmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.

I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was  
half an hour late.

I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely,  
for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf  
and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me  
that she had been waiting for some news from us.

My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt  
relieved, and was ashamed of that.

The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary  
examination.

Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other  
people because of their social status, beliefs, color and  
outlook on life (perspective).

When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that she  
was in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughed  
and started looking at me.

When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our  
relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.
Maltreatment of children.

During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This  
led to friction in a lot of situations.

When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd  
been doing behind her back.

I slept with a man purely because I found him physically  
attractive and was under the influence of alcohol.

When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best  
because of my foolishness.

My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard  
this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good  
friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in  
the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered  
so we had to put on top of the other bodies.

During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in  
speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.
When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I  
almost didn't enter University.
I lied to a friend.

I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I  
was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged  
at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).

Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money  
stolen.

When I realized that it did not make much sense to start a  
relationship with a girl who was not very constructive to  
establish a firm relationship.

When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from  
the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was  
forced to.

I wanted to get rid of a bad habit and it seemed that I had  
succeeded.  However a year later I got the bad habit again.  I felt   
useless as I always found excuses to explain my behaviour.  As a result I  
felt guilty.
Death of General Ye Jianying.

I had this feeling when my parents distroyed a relationship with  
a boy because they thought he was bad and irresponsible.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and  
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry.  
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the  
workshift to me so I did not sign up.

When the doctor told me that there was something wrong with my  
eye and I had to undergo an operation.

During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an  
ear-ring.

I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I  
realized that they probably were still there.
Failing an examn.

I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did  
not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid  
that he would grumble.
When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.

In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and  
invalids.
I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.

So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved  
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially  
my family - forever.

It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me a  
surprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.

I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was  
slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me  
and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit  
the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to  
go back and see if I caused him to crash.

When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects  
his way of interpreting reality.

When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on  
the grounds of coming home late.
I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of  
Education.

On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my  
bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the  
Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.

It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made  
a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her  
awfully.

About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was  
nothing wrong with me.
Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a  
beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in  
the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty  
bottle with me.

A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had  
made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in  
a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be  
considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did  
not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And  
most important she also liked me.
When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumours  
about my affair with a close friend.
Not noticing my roommates quietness or a sign of discomfort.

My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get  
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were  
sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feel  
bad.

When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that  
I had no time and that I would play with him the next day.  
However, the next day I said the same thing.

When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in  
public.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher  
Institute.
I refused to lend my homework to a friend.

I once watched the series called "Dynasty" on TV, and I detested  
it.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started  
to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and  
after a while I was crying.

On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very  
disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been  
aggressive though he could have been.

Found out that me and my best friend are both chosen for the  
English lectures.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He  
had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison  
with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of  
guilt.

When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from  
Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus  
holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt  
angry over his actions.
Someone I know and respect sexually assulted a girl.
Not handing in homeworks in time.

It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was  
during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while  
handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and  
we were together till 8 P.M.

When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which  
there was a rotten human skull.

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would  
never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed  
about what I had said.

Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking,  
picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.
Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.

I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of  
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his  
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure  
whether she saw it or not.

I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very  
drunk, as he approached us he started to undress.

When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and  
dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him  
as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we  
shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).
