Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told  
the group around us of advances I had made.
Due to some reasons my boyfriend and I decided to separate.

I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and  
hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the 
boy on the ground.
I was scared of water when I was a child.

When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my  
mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who  
is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the  
hospital.

One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not  
fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled  
out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.   
The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used  
the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.

When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same  
ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our  
feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when  
you have someone really close to share your life with.

This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the  
train to the university.  My mother told me that I spent more  
time than a woman on my toilet.  I felt a mixed emotion of shame  
and anger.

While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His  
face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but  
I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and  
vigorous in my game.

When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self  
interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......

An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an  
offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation  
that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had  
caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my  
efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had  
intended.

In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told  
the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him  
that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard  
that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

My friend came to the concert for my sake as it was me who had  
organized it and the concert was unsuccessful.
Finding out my name on the list for English lectures.

When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school  
mate.

When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the  
authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3  
days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole  
situation.
The birth of my child.
Cannot remember such a situation.

After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the  
friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers  
of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather  
embarassing situation from my past.

When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies  
took liberties, more than what was normal.

As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it  
might bite me.

It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's  
funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my  
friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad  
because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her  
as being very faithful.
When I was walking around all alone at night.

I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because  
I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with  
this person.

Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no  
dinner prepared as I had expected.
A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.

When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he  
had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my  
explanations fell on deaf ears.

A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was  
hoping for.

Being involved in a car accident and having my thumb caught in  
the glove compartment. My sister and I had a Fear of finally  
telling my parents, since my sister was the driver.
My friend not allowed to go to the English lectures.

I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me.  
That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

When I saw the film "Memorie of Prison" I saw a scene of  
masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that  
the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my  
hands.
A close friend died.

In adolescence I had a very violent fight with my sister I hold  
her stong in her neck, she had a throat surgery what make me feel  
guilty about the future reactions she might had injuring the  
surgery.
My companion admired me when I did some work voluntarily.

A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's  
sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it  
really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this  
time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him  
up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I  
felt very bad about it later.

When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.  It was my  
fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.

I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I  
categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any  
hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because  
I couldn't organize myself.

The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual  
crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

Telling a lie to wife over phone about what I had been working  
at.

Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas,  
sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.
When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.
Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
When my girlfriend left me.

Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy was  
killed and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. It  
looked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, I  
can hardly write it down.

Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad  
experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life  
etc.

The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.   
He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written  
about.

I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitals  
where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of  
the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.

When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me,  
calling me names and pushing me around.

Hearing about a friend back home that had to have his stomach  
pumped because he had overdosed on pills.

Alone in the house (late 8pm) I heard noises. Sounded like someone  
was trying to get in our back door.

Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a  
colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period  
of time.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a  
student like me.

I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the  
family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my  
friends.

At hostel, my roommate was a very selfish person and would avoid  
doing anyhting that did not concern him.  A few of us prepared lunch  
together and had decided to share the work.  My roomate had  
promised to do the same but I had to wash the bowls everytime  
after dinner.  I tried to wait and thought that he would realize  
his fault.  I did not want to tell him to do the work as he is a  
university student and ought to have self-respect.  He  
disappointed me and so every time I saw him I tried to avoid him  
and did not want to keep any contact with him.
When I failed my first biochemistry test.

The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of  
economics.

When I failed Psychology examination when most of the students  
passed.

An hour before receiving the certificate results I was very  
frightened.  When I saw others crying I felt very tense and as  
time went by my fear grew.

A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had  
communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that  
person as well as myself because I had partly submitted.

The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be  
operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was  
mater of life or death.
Lost a friend.
A father of 4 children killed in an accident.

I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go  
home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear  
it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by  
talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess,  
blinding and blaming.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at  
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and  
in general the best records of all the candidates.

It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared  
to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to  
darkness - until somebody had to escort me.

When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for  
myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.

I had too much homework and examinations and I did not know how  
to organize my work.

I saw a movie called "The Thing", the film directed by John  
Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted.

Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming  
me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my  
boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude  
himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his  
girlfriend.

I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after  
not attending his lectures.

During a football game, another player who was perspiring very  
strongly ran into me.

I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the  
wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very  
denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing  
with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was  
unable to answer.

I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close  
person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.
Some students trying to please the lecturer.

When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the  
driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.
Relating to my closest family.

I was not able to help my sister to understand that her husband  
is a bad man before she was married to him.

I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I  
realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop -  
and I then needed the money.

When I became conscious that men don't wnat anything they don't  
have a goal. They have: sex, but this isn't important.

When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother.   
He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without my  
brother realizing it.

Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What  
had happened is that something had been written against my  
friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me   
-"you also signed ?"

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several  
reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical  
check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because  
someone had informed me about it.
Did not return the library book on time.

I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl  
when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.

My child passed away after a short illness when he was just  
eleven months old. I was only told about his death without  
knowing that he had been ill.
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
A very close friend left me.

When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry.  
I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does   
badly at school, my family members blame me as well.

There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this  
terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.

When I found that my ability to do ordinary work was worse than  
my fellow mates.
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character  
comes towards me.

When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a  
profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak  
from the stand by drawing lots.

When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling  
started to be worse after a while.

I went to a friend's baptism as she became a Christian after me  
and I realized that she was more enthusiastic about her spiritual  
life than I was.  When I was with my brothers and sisters of  
Christ I had a guilty feeling which could not be dismissed  
easily.  When pepole asked me as to when I would be baptised my  
guilt feeling deepened.

I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of being  
assaulted.

At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me who  
had laughed, and she punished the entire class by making them  
stay behind for one hour.
Did badly in an examn.

One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I  
thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was  
serious.

I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I  
had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I  
was too young to join elderly people.

After learning on the news about this man who killed more than  
300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.

When I met another person I began to go out with him, and my  
boyfriend (with marriage accorded) met us together he did a great  
scandal, he broke the engagement and I began to go out with the  
other, and it didn't work because my mind was all mixed up.

My mother was very angry with my little sister and told her to  
put her hands on the table in order to beat her hands up. She  
forced by means of her power.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long  
separation.
When I came back from my holidays.

One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone out  
with her and not with me.

When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend  
and he was calling me to talk about it.

I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late  
to find some visitors at my place.

I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed  
about it, I felt joy.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned  
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and  
discovered several untoward things had occurred.

I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I  
was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but  
I did not.
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.

I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted  
by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a  
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the  
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said  
and done on the night before.
Can't remember any such feelings now.

When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at  
night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody  
around that I could run to.

I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately  
my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his  
feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.

When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and  
hindered by my cousin.

When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss  
that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss  
was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary  
was taken away from him.

When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought  
there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and  
trembled.

When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However  
I know that she loves me.

When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from a  
stationery store because I didn't have enough money.

When I left after the examination to enter the University, and  
even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the  
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the  
door closed.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and  
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for  
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own  
feelings were intensified.

When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a  
performance.  We missed it.

One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, I  
took my girlfriend home.  While driving back home, I felt that I  
had not handled the whole thing very well.
When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

Once at midnight, I was working alone at office and the phone  
suddenly rang.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally  
grew into anger.
An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.

I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I  
was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on  
absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up  
it.

When I learnt that my younger sister had been expelled from  
secondary school because she was pregnant.  That was the second  
time that this happened in the family - the first time it had  
been my elder sister.
A friend asked for help and I was not able to help.

When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which  
turned out to be untrue).
Shame of being reprehended.

I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for  
my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a  
friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there  
was something fishy.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned  
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature  
National Olympiad.

When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook the  
grade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.

I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the  
car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away.  
At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it  
cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week  
(including rent).

In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while  
peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.

On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on  
the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of  
standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was  
also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to  
the Principal.

I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which  
I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt  
guilty.

When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about  
herself.

I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold  
Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I  
couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and  
saved me.
A certain night during initiation.
At a prolonged separation with my family.

A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybody  
but not me.

My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to  
his friend at a cheaper price.

While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with  
a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too  
raggy.

My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about  
kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I  
knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her  
hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable  
smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.

When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had  
got in an easter egg.
Going out alone in the dark.
Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.

When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about  
my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical  
insight.

In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed,  
leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of  
one of the actors.

When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while   
we were playing near his home.

I went to the apartment of my boyfriend and saw some people  
before his door. I thought that something had happened.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the  
politicians and the police.

When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there  
naked.

[ During a certain period, I felt successful and extremely satisfied.    
When I found that any tasks or decisions that I had made were better   
than expected.]

A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost money  
on my way home from the college.

When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and  
I felt totally helpless.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some  
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like  
that.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left  
alone in this unfamiliar country.

When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my  
father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even  
speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from  
school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and  
contempt.
When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

[ When bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or when  
someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]

My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me  
about it before.

I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving  
it or when someone deceives me.

I was admited to the Chinese university of Hong Kong.  The day  
the results were announced I looked in the newspaper and saw my  
candidature number.

During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy  
meat dishes which make me feel sick.

When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach me  
beacause of prejudice.

I received money from my father at a time when I was completely  
broken.

Did not get up early enough to watch my class football team  
playing against another team.

A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her  
back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled  
the wrong number.

When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a  
very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking  
corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident  
happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver,  
after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was  
with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who  
were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in  
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a  
scholarship for an excellent grade.

In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt  
guilty so I told them the truth and felt free.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.

At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her,  
and not being committed to her.

In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to  
a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had  
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he  
feels glad.

One day when I was sitting in a not very crowded bus, a middle   
aged woman was standing beside me.  The person sitting next to me  
got up to get off and this woman pushed me and occupied the seat.  
 Then she took off her shoes and put her feet on the seat.
Beating my brother up.

Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across  
an exhibitionist.

When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was  
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not  
surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.
When unjustified hurting other people.

One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient.  
Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and  
it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid  
fearing the dead body.

Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket.  
The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.
After having failed my driving test.

I made a joke about the rat of a boy. I compared his rat with a  
sausage. I told the boy he had a delicious sausage.

During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and  
other family members crying.
When I forgot my mother's birthday.

When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual  
emotion.
Squeezed the puppy in the door.

Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to  
structure.

When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young  
prostitute who was not older than 18.

When high level results were declared, I found my candidature  
number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been   
injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.

When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were  
not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.
Doing anatomy alone for the first time.
When I don't fulfill my obligations.

When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our  
holiday together.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my  
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign  
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we  
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I  
didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were  
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to  
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the  
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine  
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too  
late for anyone to give us a lift.
Having passed an exam.

It was when I drunk urine during my childhood thinking it was  
water. My friend had urinated in the tin.

One day, when I was sitting on the bus, there was an old woman  
standing beside me.  I was very tired and sleepy and did not  
think of giving her my seat.  A 50 year old woman who was sitting  
beside me got up and gave her seat to the old woman and said,   
" Old woman, please take my seat, the youngstters these days are  
not used to giving their seats to others."  When I heard these  
words I was very ashamed of myself and wanted to get off the bus  
at once.

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the  
opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions  
as negative. We however only posed several questions which she  
couldn't answer.

I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a  
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the  
large number of pupils who fail.
I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.

I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the  
first time with a girl.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the  
varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.
When I heard that I had passed the second year exams.

A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me  
and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was  
nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very  
disgusting.
When I talk to my friends.

I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a  
question and I could not answer it.

I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed  
to answer a question in the classroom.

Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I  
expected.

My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my  
birthday he forgot he promised this to me.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not  
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was,  
and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to  
please God. I could never understand how something that brings you  
joy could be a sin.

When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were  
magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.
When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.

When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I  
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very  
hungry.

When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was  
not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two  
weeks. That was very unpleasant.

At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do  
silly things.

When I was in grade one, one day I felt like going to the toilet  
during class but I was very scared of the teacher so I urinated  
in the class.

When I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One  
day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and   
my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I  
really felt ashamed then.

When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been  
vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time  
to call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.

When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and  
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange  
for the ones I had given her.

When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang -  
very hard to replace).

Not being chosen for the English lectures (my girl-friend  
chosen).

I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.    
When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.

My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the  
hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic  
Hospital, then he died.

I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she  
wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found  
out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use  
it. She never found out.
When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the  
group.
Someone talking about me at my back.
Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me  
cringe, feel disgust.

When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians  
at ther wedding.
When a thief broke into my house at night.

One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because  
she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it.  
Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She  
could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt  
very angry.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I  
have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in  
deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

[ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt,  
decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility,  
office and service; and the rampant corruption at every single  
level of education and other institutions.]

When the others did not do their bit of work on a group  
assignment task, and I had to do all the work.

In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times  
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no  
disastrous consequences.

When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the  
boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would  
accidentally go off.

When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and I  
insisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.

I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and  
sister, and with me too.

When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL  
Football team) which I am a member and can only see the situation  
in a bad light and always put the team down.

When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the  
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his  
friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would  
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of  
other persons.
Once I had to visit a rather special person.

Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither  
up nor down.

It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the  
first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be  
easy.

I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became  
awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion)  
nonsens reason.

When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  
 nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia  
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the  
events that were taking place there.
When I was in the toilet and someone came in.

The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of  
us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had  
no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got  
engaged.

One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend  
died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the  
funeral I felt very sad.
Being misunderstood by friends.

A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor  
of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We  
decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning  
because we had business on the following day. The instructor  
tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite  
of everything, all the time he made me angry.
I felt guilt when I betrayed the person whom I loved.

I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any  
explanations.

I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other  
person didn't appear.

I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she did  
not agree to it.

When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than  
to my mother.
When there is danger nearby.

When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I  
thought he was disgusted and "a friend" of mine for whom I feel a  
little disgust wanted to stay with him.

When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission  
first.

When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite  
my excellent certificate.

When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the  
whole night at a graduation party ceremony.

My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not  
care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of  
concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur  
like a brother. He was easy to talk to.

A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to  
enter on University in Dallas, and was approved.
[ When my performance (homework or other work) is better than others.]
When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.

When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was  
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.
When my dog died.

It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fanta  
bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.

When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I  
was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back  
together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was  
very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.

When I found out my roommate had been talking behind my back  
about very personal things.

Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel  
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted  
to say.  Thoughtlessness.

When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that  
I judged very difficult.

When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial  
burden of the family was reduced.

A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the  
street.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and  
it was moving its limbs.

A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene  
words.

Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There  
was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the  
bridge was completely muddled.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.

When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although  
I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.
A break-up with someone I really liked.

When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness  
to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.

I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed  
away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking  
to her yet she is dead.

I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the  
right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to  
raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.
The results of the mid term examinations were very poor.

After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and  
having been stupidly cross in every way.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of  
mine.

When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine  
as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part  
with a few coins for their drinks.

Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who  
the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and  
bad but it was too late.

Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in  
tutorial.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and  
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.
When I feigned sick leave from work.
When my father died.

I was in a garden one evening and I saw a snake coming towards  
me.

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me,  
though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on  
them.
A TV program on whale-hunting.

When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to  
see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us  
with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he  
got more money.

My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself  
because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign  
myself to it.
[ I have not felt this emotion.]
Accepted by the college football team.

When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When  
I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my  
car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and  
furthermore it was raining.

A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a  
shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat,  
then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous  
from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the  
bench.

I had planned a trip to the South during Easter, together with a  
friend. She was very sorry when I changed my mind and decided not  
to go after all.

I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I  
tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was  
amused.

Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in  
Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and  
masturbated.  Very disgusting.

Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much.  
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their  
group, although it was late in the evening.

A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad  
manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their  
telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.

When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining  
low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent  
as they are when you are young.
Talking to a close friend.
Can't remember having had this feeling.
My inability to assert myself positively in a group.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball  
offending her relatives.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He  
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.
A conflict with a pupil.
The day I finished my military service.

When I dined with my new friends, one of them kept reminding us  
that he was superior.

[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something  
in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]

The negative feelings towards me displayed by my  
"parents-in-law".

On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend,  
I caused her to be physically harmed.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings  
in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with  
complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the  
hand of the other person, etc...

When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not  
allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I  
made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place,  
though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with  
my pals.

I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a  
friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was  
revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a  
motorcycle through my own efforts.

It was a shameful moment when I heard that I had failed my  
Primary School leaving Certificate Exam in 1978. My girlfriend  
was there when the news was released.
Failing in an exam.

Once while walking along a hill; I fell down out of carelessness  
and I broke my left arm.
Arguing about price with private shop-assistant.
When I got indecent offers.

I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of  
alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting  
next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.

A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin  
and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about  
it.

When I was a child I had to recite a poem in a show at the end of  
the term.

My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from  
time to time.

For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very  
happy.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

My friend often played a joke on me and sometimes I thought that  
he was a nonsensical person. Once when we went to a friend's  
house he walked in first and shut the door firmly behind him.  I  
felt that he did not respect me and moreover I was his friend so  
he should not have behaved like that.  I was very angry (as it is  
I was in a bad mood then).

When I was in F4 I played a basket-ball match against another  
school's team.  One of their team members kicked a team-mate of  
mine so I kicked him back and we had a fight with each other.

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end  
of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to  
get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards  
him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to  
go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful  
message.

In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name for  
mine (a boy's name).  I realized my mistake only when I went up  
to the stage for the prize.  I did not know what to do as  
everyone was looking at me.  I blushed and went back to my seat.

In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison  
and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read  
detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less  
powerful people.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a  
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose  
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried  
to be intimate with me.

I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him  
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more  
glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range,  
and was shot at.
My cat died painfully and slowly.
When I failed the grade 7.

When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets  
worried and this made me feel angry.
Thought had discovered true love.

When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a  
school of my choice.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I  
were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise  
from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house.  
 A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this  
alley.

At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle   
of a lesson.
I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.
When I and the boy next door set fire to a house by accident.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal  
marks.
Because of the examination I had to study night and day.

One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.  When the lecturer asked  
us as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one who  
put up his hand and this surprised the whole class.

When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend  
was crying and I was sad, too.

I needed a recommendation for something. I decided that the best  
person to get one from was a professor who I had never talked to  
before. I felt a lot of fear going up after class to ask him to  
recommend me considering he had never heard my name before. But I  
did.
Walking in the dark by myself.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to  
come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

When I was ill and had to stay at the hospital for a period of  
time.

My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months  
in hospital.

I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately  
we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was  
ashamed when I told my friend about it.

I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that  
didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

When I opted for my research field, for them the percentage of  
marks was more important than my knowledge.

My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they  
adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of  
other people.
When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's  
place.
When my grandfather died.

I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night  
club.
When my brother was born.

When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls,  
because my car had broken down.

I was disgusted when our cricket team manager dropped me from the  
team.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this  
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was  
quite strong.

When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another  
person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and  
kept thinking of her all day long.

My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to  
tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.   
Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.

When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I  
was entertaining my mother who had come from home.  However, I  
later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I  
had taken out another girlfriend of mine.
Heard about someone telling lies about me to my best friend.

I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I  
could not remember the words I had to say.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not  
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She  
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time,  
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When a "friend" woke me up in the middle of a blessful sleep by  
knocking on the door.  Then he started calling me names and  
saying that he had heard that I had been talking behind his back, this  
was a lie and the guy was drunk to the core.

I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But  
when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten  
it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her  
husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.
I was neglected undeservedly.

When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and  
soul.

When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the  
South African boycott.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.

When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so  
bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized  
how bad it was.

When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a  
fortnight.

The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple  
sleeping in thier place.

When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt  
well and very happy for being able to express to myself something  
that was suffocating me.

One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to  
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
When my son was born.
Birth of children.

The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and  
she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.

My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought  
another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I  
felt quite ashamed of myself.

When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a  
chair.

I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved  
who had to leave for her motherland.

When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that  
disgusted me.

When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even  
though she knew that she was wrong.
When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great  
esteem.

I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started  
vomiting. It was so disgusting.

When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar,  
after baving tried for a long time.
Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I  
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just  
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back  
home.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high school  
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the  
whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done  
excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My  
family was at home.

[ I do not remember when I last felf ashamed.  I do not usually  
feel ashamed of what I do.]

I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for  
me, I was very glad.
I felt guilty when I "stole" the boyfriend of a friend of mine.
To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very  
happy.

My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry.   
After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons.   
One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling my  
mother about it.  When my mother learnt this she beat her up and  
even threatened her with a pair of scissors.

I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their  
animals very badly. They disgusted me.

I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody  
in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following  
me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At  
last I arrived home.

I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights  
were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that  
the dogs may be outside.

I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I  
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time -  
wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had  
to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell  
exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certain  
person to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knew  
what I wanted.

Finding out about the university does not have enough foreign  
currency to buy the yournals in your reference list.
My father promoted to be a professor.
When I heard that my father had passed away.

When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around with  
another boy.

My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.  At midnight a  
male stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.  I  
hung up and heard someone walking outside our door.

During the English lesson we were required to do a play.  A few  
days after doing it the teacher asked us to do it again at a meeting   
and I forgot my part.

I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train  
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt  
glad.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.

Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my  
parents.

Feeling helpless, not being able to accomplish what I really  
wanted to do.

My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that  
I had intended to keep for as long as possible.

I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help  
me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and  
meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got  
angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator  
as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I  
had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.
Did not finish homework.
Getting ill.

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others  
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.
Failing an examn.

When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in  
me.

When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting a  
conservative government.

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away  
instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to  
wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.

Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone  
gave them money.
When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my  
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any  
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a  
long time.

I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was  
fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.
Death of my father.
After my boyfriend and I had separated.

An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had  
taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he  
asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I  
looked for it, I found it in my room.
When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.
The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect,  
lied to me.

When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the  
hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one  
weekend from CAL to take me home.

When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he  
had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and  
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints  
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.

When I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my father  
when he came back from work.  One day it so happened that his  
hair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and when I  
opened the door as usual I saw something else.  I was so scared  
that I could not talk.
My girl-friend left me.

When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken  
her time.

Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I  
didn't study.

Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when I  
believed I was acting honestly and fairly.

after getting a fail notice for a math class, I realized I was  
not doing very well in school in any subject. I began to fear  
failing a class or two.

When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It  
made me forget all my problems.

When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I  
had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a  
malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.
When I failed an exam.

When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be  
heard.

When I accused unjustly a person of robbery, who proved me the  
contrary, almost caused a public fight.

When I saw the certificate results, I did not feel very happy as I  
did not realize that I had got all the credits until my  
classmates pointed it out to me.  My parents and my relatives  
praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B,  
2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.
When an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

Attending to a demand made by a client (I work in a bank) I  
suggested her an application of money in a week ahead, but I  
informed her wrongly. The client arrived a week after and the  
application wasn't made and she lost with this a lot of time and  
money.

After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first  
semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at  
my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.
When I got the loan for my studies.

I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation.   
One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and at  
that moment I hated him.
Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.

I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone  
deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their  
clothes and their way of doing.

At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had  
grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on  
the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now, he is sitting  
there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet  
boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.
When I got my B.Sc degree with first class.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends,  
after not having seen them for six months.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic  
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I  
expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc,  
thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I  
walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been  
seeing many others during our relationship.
Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.

In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to  
wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the  
highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its  
loudest.

My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he  
had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and  
I felt very angry at him.

I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the  
people with a high standard of living.
At work a boy was injured because of my lack of supervision.

Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my  
mother's presence.

I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth  
persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.

When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of  
deep perturbation.
Failed to be elected to be a class leader.
Not doing my share of the work for the house job.

One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends  
without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

I was then in the 10th standard and was going to my native place.  
 The last bus had already left and so I started walking, it soon  
became quite dark.  The road was a village road and was deserted,  
I was not even sure if that was the right way.  I finally reached  
home at 10 P.M.

I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another  
collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for  
many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I  
wouldn't know what to say.

When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived  
and "different" from other children at school.
Insulted by classmate in public.

I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is  
studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.   
Her arrival is always a joyous one.

A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer  
and has only a year to live.  I  heard about it 6 weeks ago.

One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt  
to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.   
We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of  
the consequences.
Staying in a relative's house which was broken in before.

The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness  
was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also  
experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do  
to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some  
things I did not consider morally right).

When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of  
medicine.
My roommate was rude to me.

I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I  
had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village.  And we were caught  
red handed there by a form master.
Meeting other friends who got in the good universities.

When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated  
from them for about three months.
I was told to do something I did not want to do.
When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost  
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

At my native place I was riding my cycle, which did not have  
lights, at night and so a police man caught me.  I requested him  
to let me go but he would not so after a few minutes I just  
escaped.

I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics.  
I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious to  
see it.
When my grandmother passed away.
My admittance to the University.
When my father thought that I was an unrelaible son.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no  
one to help me and call First Aid.

Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling  
and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in  
effect lowering myself to their level.

Upon reading a story on a serial killer by the name of Henry Lee  
Lucas who has been given the distinction of killing more people  
that any other man. I began to wonder if I should take more care  
for my safety.

I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought  
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red  
switch.

Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I  
failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation  
because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.
Watching a horror film.

When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance  
exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.

When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class  
during a turn.

I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's  
where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the  
beach - on the way I got a puncture.

When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard       
when it entered my room at night.

On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a  
friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.
Falling in love with a close friend.

I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known  
that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this  
message he was already dead.

In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation  
was disgusting in itself.
Some students deliberately disobey me as a class leader.

I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. I  
forgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get to  
know them.
General Ye Jianying died.

At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not  
familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my  
ignorance.

I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00  
already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late  
but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could  
have been.

When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time  
had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long  
time.
On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.
When someone makes advances that one does not want.

When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of  
delinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.  I was  
afraid of the people near me and the future consequences.

When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very  
close to me.

When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I  
had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently  
qualified.
Not finishing homework in time.

Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, and  
his English is worse than mine.

I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our  
"11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red  
rose.

This was when one of the Clinical officers scolded us in the  
hospital on how to make beds but we did not deserve to be  
scolded.
Before an exam in logics.

A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to  
turn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a  
turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we  
were gone.

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have  
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e  
continously interrupting me by telephoning.

It was a week before the higher level results were announced.  I  
had tried and failed many times and this was the last time that  
I was taking the exam.  I knew that if i failed again I woulld  
have to enter the society.  I imagined things during this period  
- I dreamt that I had entered university and it was a nice  
experience.  When I thought about the future, an unexplainable  
fear rose in me.  I feared being a worker and not having a bright  
prospect, I also feared the criticism of my relatives as my  
brother had gone to university.  Whenevr I thought of this issue  
I could not eat or concentrate, and my heart beat increased.

Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after  
discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not  
responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for  
some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.
The possibility of having failed the examination.

During a class I was asked a question which I did not hear very  
clearly, so I gave an answer which was not related to the  
question and everyone started laughing at me.

I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The  
incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I  
wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me,  
though nothing very serious actually happened.
I was alone and someone tried to break in from our back door.

When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg -  
causing great pain, and for me, severe embarassment at my own  
ineptitude, and shame that another person suffered as a result.
Spit and vomit.

When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of  
an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from  
the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an  
acquaintance in the car with me.
When I got a letter from home.
I have a new born child.
When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.

When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me  
in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed  
with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked  
me and threatened me.

My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools  
and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.

When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a  
prostitute.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with  
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made  
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough  
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.

I had left a student newspaper of the Chinese university on the  
table of the library.  It had disappeared when I came back.

When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a  
bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something  
very precious.

I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did  
something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though  
he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.

I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she  
genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost  
taking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I should  
not.

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad  
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
When I attended the concert of a pop singer.

In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep  
two or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sent  
back.

Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering,  
over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I  
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of  
their daughter's buisness.

A friend started to insult another person without reason and I  
felt ashamed of her behavior.

One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we  
began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the  
figs were full of worms.

Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by  
some people because he was found raping the wife of the village  
headman.
When quarreling with friends.

I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to  
attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.

On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long  
time.

I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw  
a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and  
ran out of the forest.

And she said absurd things, false things that filled my ears and  
inflated my head which seemed to be caught in a carcass where the  
heart wanted to explode and where the arm wanted to knock down  
the world.

We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and I  
was holding my ground.  They showed me that I was wrong.
Doing this pointless questionnaire.

We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work.  
It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.

One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had  
been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the  
soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having  
lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to  
why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me  
before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would  
look very nice if we wore them together.
My father insulted by other people.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my  
siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the  
party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A  
guy called and said, in effect, that I was "nice" and he liked  
me. Hence the emotional joy.
Seeing this badly made questionnaire.

At an anti-pornography meeting, when samples from films and  
magazines were shown.

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation  
and they are together now).
A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.

We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with  
her job, I stayed in bed all day.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.

I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a  
good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents  
and through them from the pupils.

A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized  
later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the  
wrong place.

I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached  
me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at  
me.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine.  
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of  
separation from summer.
I fear before each exam.
When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).

When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I  
worked during Autumn 1984.
When a close friend drowned in the American River.

When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a  
pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do  
not care very much about children.

I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some  
incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.
To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.

When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima  
with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who  
lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt  
ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with  
western Europe.

When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved  
incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from  
school.

When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the  
teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often  
with her.

The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and  
experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total  
enlightenment and freedome - bliss.

I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I  
saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.

Tutorial again !  A fearful feeling came to me when I sat on the  
chair and looked at my fellow students all around.  I was really  
scared that they would ask me some questions or challenge the  
ideas that I had presented.

A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected  
manner.

I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.   
More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a
