death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, with 
vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.

When I argue with my sister.  It feels sometimes that I have the  
upper hand and I use it.  I often argue better and this makes her  
terribly angry.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).

I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted  
with fear.  I thought that someone's cold hand or something  
similar had touched my hand.  I crept down under the covers and  
went back to sleep.

The day the results of the Chinese university was announced I  
should have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of   
her prejudice and misunderstanding, started a  quarrel with my  
mother.  She expected me to take her side and she deliberately  
talked of my mother's wrong doings.  I was very angry because -  
one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because it  
should have been a happy day and three we had moved into a new  
house that day.
When I failed one of the first year's courses.

When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was  
the first time that I lost a brother.

When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the  
university. Due to students own lack of concern for the  
environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea  
and coffee left everywhere.
Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.

When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked  
underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to  
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class  
with her in our first year.
When I thought that I had failed the examination.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was  
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve  
the pains of a patient.
Not being accepted by classmates in university.
When the summer holiday job was almost over.

When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me  
picking my nose.

When I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the  
food had gone bad.

When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we  
realized that he had been listening.
When I lost my father in a car accident.
After the death of a girl who I disliked.
Saw a very arrogant girl walking like a queen.
Every time I went home with my school report.
Father lost his temper at home because he was mistreated at work.

A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too  
because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I  
feel joy for her mainly.
The same for guilt would apply.

When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.  It felt  
awful to see such suffering.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from  
Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my  
uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final  
journey within four days.
I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.

During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in  
the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have  
fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked  
me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he  
didn't deserve it.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very  
long time.

I wanted to go out to walk but I didn't know either where or  
with whom, suddenly an invitation appeared.
At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle  
of the class and I had to gesticulate.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my  
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous  
year's exam.
Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.

The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level  
headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell  
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

I had written a "love-letter" to a class-mate of mine, this was  
meant to be a joke.  Unfortunately it fell in the wrong hands   
and I had to face the consequences.
Got through first semester University.

The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to  
take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started  
running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save  
myself.

I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At  
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids  
were on the move.
A night spent with a group of friends.
When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him  
about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry  
because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and  
instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the  
same day.

During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted  
her parents by having had sex in their house which they  
overheard.

My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days  
later he stole it from my father.

When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in  
an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not  
know how to get back home.

A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite  
fortunately).

When I heard that my father had been involved in a car accident  
in Lusaka.  This happened when he had gone to get the car which  
had been stolen in Lusaka.
Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a  
woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so  
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other  
in such a degrading way.
I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.
Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.

Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in  
a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.   
He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

I "snapped" very abruptly at my mother when she said something  
silly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked so  
defenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that.

I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that  
my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my  
brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused  
of spending a night out.

When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel  
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.
My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt my  
team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and  
punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and  
the match had to be cut short.
When my father was involved in an accident.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one  
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my  
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was  
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an  
improper and unsavoury conversation.

When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was  
now a female (I don't know it/them personally).

I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We  
do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take  
out my anger on him.

I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently  
from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother  
had understood it.

On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet  
of flowers.
Renewed contact with an earlier friend.
When I "hated" one of mmy flatmates who was nice to me.

Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having  
done it and knowing that they knew.

I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to  
illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.
Not being able to answer question in a seminar.

[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended  
on my conduct.]

I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a  
person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.
Can't remember that feeling.

When my brother went out with my new shirt that I adored, and  
returned it dirty with grease.

I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the  
start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I  
told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.

Saw two Canadian students boasting about how rich they are in  
Canada.

Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't  
think I committed.

In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and  
the others started laughing.

The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of  
leaves behind our house.

Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before  
she died.

I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage.  
I didn't make the test.

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in  
recent broken relationship.

When I was first exposed to the dead bodies, for dissecting         
purposes at the school of medicine.
During a fight with my best friend.

When I was in primary 6, my father died.  I was very young then  
and did not know what had happened.  The weeping of my relatives  
and my tears made me sad.

At night when I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena  
crying in the Lingadzi jungle. I was alone.

When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an  
examination.
Hit a dog with my car, and didn't stop.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
Fooling around with this guy I did not know.

When the brother-in-law of a girlfriend of mine found us in a  
bedroom with clothes and panties spread all over the place.

When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident,  
and found that a close school friend had been killed.
When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.

When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was  
pregnant.

I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was  
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was  
unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and  
slammed the door.

When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant  
Training.
I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my  
mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

An out-patient asked me to read for him a certain prescription  
but I was unable to do so. The patient was dissappointed and lost  
hope in me.

When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for  
several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath  
the air that smelled of her presence.
When I met my mother after months of absence.

My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours  
late.

Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classes  
and not studying much.

When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who   
was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was  
really angry with him then.
I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2  
yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he  
diagnosed it.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased  
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had  
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that  
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither  
his fault nor mine.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to  
stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all  
because of my brothers.

When students in our working group showed no responsibility or  
interest in our work.

When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and  
one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real  
bad about it.

A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to  
my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got  
to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she  
arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later  
ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at  
my place.
Before the examn.
When my grandmother died of cancer.

Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that  
she loves me.
Receiving a letter from a boy I care.

When I was betrayed by a friend, and decided to stay apart form  
her.

When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the  
power of money.

My brother wanted me to buy a flute with him but I didn't accept  
afterwards I regretted it because he became sad.

I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this  
put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started  
withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness  
and dirtyness.
The death of my father.

When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister,  
Indira Gandhi.
Death in the close family.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the  
co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have  
this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in  
doing his duty.
When they stole my dark blue tennis.

Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the  
telephone.
Saw a classmate knocked down by a motorcycle.
Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.

When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made  
me wonder if he was a really a good friend.

I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend  
inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long  
time. And at times still get angry at him.

I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this  
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
Caught lying to my father about a speeding ticket I had received.

I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I  
would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the    
doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was  
actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day  
and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt  
guilty when asked to explain things on my return.

On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man  
in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell  
asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much,  
neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my  
mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father  
had to carry me to bed.

A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared  
that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.
I finished my homework

I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in  
reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be  
a quarrel because of my being late.
When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.

I was in a very small class and the professor said something  
about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing wather  
to each other in front of the door of my house. One day we  
decided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped and  
went to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.

Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my  
teacher spotted me.
My friend was badly hurt.

When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16  
months ago.

I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his  
friends.
Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.
I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.

I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend  
told me that she would go to travel next year with another good  
friend. We couldn't talk this out.

After a long time (of no communication with him, physical  
illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected  
to see him.

On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me.  
At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills  
me with disgust.
Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.

To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear  
delayed me acting to do this.

When I had to travel alone, unescorted for the first time.     It  
was an over-night journey by train to a distant place.

I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with  
myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I  
rarely become ashamed.

When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking  
behind my back.

When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me  
"a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.
NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.

It was discovered that I had received a warning letter as my  
G.P.A was very low.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not  
enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not  
have fitted in and there was something in that.

When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some  
weeks.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.

My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When  
my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started  
shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.

I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for  
my studies.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she  
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used  
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends  
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to  
stop using it.

During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know  
in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered  
her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our  
adresses.
I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.

When I tried to hide a fact from a person for irrelevant reasons  
and considered such an attitude childish.
When my grandfather died.

This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and  
found him screwing my girlfriend.

I separated with the one I liked most.  She refused all my dates  
and told me that she had dated another one.  My heart seemed to  
cease beating.  I was silent for some time and then I whispered  
goodbye and left without turning back.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected  
with copying at a class-work at school.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned"  
relations.

I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when  
I said I would.

Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caught  
speeding.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I  
had taken this test.

When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in  
the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what  
would happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.

After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived  
interstate, had remembered when I'd get back and phoned to  
welcome me home on the night of my arrival.

When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a  
"Jungle Spider") ran out near me. (I do not like even small  
spiders).

Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and  
very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The  
heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very  
angry.

I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for  
it, and I was caught red handed.

I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the  
examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term  
results I am left with a sense of guilt.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief  
when you are away from home, too.

A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys I  
knew. It sounded really childish.

The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights,  
phisical aggrssion, etc.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed  
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because  
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able  
to join the conversation.

When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking  
out of the glass.

When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first  
time.

Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I  
was alive or dead, I remained "cold levered" during the situation  
but felt great fear.
Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.

I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard  
from a good friend (from my home town).
When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.

One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my  
friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we  
stayed indoors.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.
Stealing money from my parents when I was young.

When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously  
and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly  
damaged.

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School  
out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful.  
Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers  
who had passed after repeating for several times.

Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that  
there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who  
it was and why he was there.

When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and  
disappointed.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade  
eight.

When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was  
also very sad) "Oh, how I hated him".
When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.
Not being able to help my friend to do homework.

My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still  
living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had  
to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale  
enterprise).

I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I  
was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
When I failed some tests my first year at CAL.

Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certain  
contract.

A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I  
stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody  
wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought  
you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course", I said, but I  
thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought  
it.

I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I  
would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the  
afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled),  
watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances -  
pressures of examinations in particular.

My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me  
a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my  
parent's place I will remember it for long time.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for  
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas  
Years ago.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he asked  
me to study by myself first but I did not do it.  When he asked me  
 if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we  
started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said  
that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some  
time later I apologized for that.

While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an  
acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling  
false stories about herself and praising herself.
When passing the final examinations for social worker.

One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my   
parents.   I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I   
had to tolerate him !  The quarrel made my father think that his children   
may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and   
this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).  I was   
still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen   
to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.
I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our  
relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was  
very angry about that.

A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of  
mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also  
some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.
I angered a close friend and he was injured.

When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity  
better but I had not done it because of reluctance or  
carelessness.
My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from  
airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in  
contact again.

When I had my first oral examination after a long time;  
especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling  
that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up  
for it.

One of my friends came to know through some other friends that I    
had applied for some course in an institute.  He asked me "why  
did not you tell me, I would also have applied."  At that I felt  
guilty.

When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion of  
pregnancy.
My mother was ill and my father was not at home.

I omitted to do a favor to a friend, while he was very much in  
need for help.

A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came  
to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe  
dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he  
seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.   
Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke  
to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.
When I was scolded by my dad for bad behaviour.

When I could not pass my exams with good marks.  My wedding was  
to take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convince  
myself that this was the reason for my not having done well.    
However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well at  
the exams I would have done well.

Joining in a research group studying consumer's behaviour and  
helping the people in the shop with the sales.
When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

A friend told me that a boy wanted to get to know me.  At that  
time I felt disgusted and thought that it was a nonsense thing.

I saved up money for a good purpose. As I also have to organise a  
party I am afraid there will rest only a little money for the  
good purpose I feel guilty about this.

Despite our good performance and excellent results the management  
refused to meet our demands.

One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and  
this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got  
in my car and went away.

Having finally to admit I was wrong, after having denied it for a  
long time.

Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was  
very late and I thought something awful had happened.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite  
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest  
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I  
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them  
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my  
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was  
quite  disappointed and disgusted.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a  
stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out  
4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and  
should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could  
walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.

I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on  
her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that  
she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her  
addiction.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years.  
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and  
did not have to do the remaining 5 months.
When I masturbated in my room.

When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing a  
flute early in the morning while I was trying to study.
I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.

I had joined a youth group that observed the affairs of our  
community and so I had many opportunities to contact the  
government and the committee members of the district board (a  
local executive structure).  We always tried to consult and  
discuss with them, but we found that such people did not  
understand community affairs and they even dampened our  
enthusiasm in local affairs.  I did not understand why they had  
decided to work as community leaders.
When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.
When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.
The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

Once when I was walking alone at mid-night, I happened to put my  
foot on a frog, as it felt smooth I thought that it was a snake   
and I felt afraid.

I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war.  
After the film I felt disgust.
[ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]

When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important  
family occasion that I should not have missed.

I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It  
seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.
I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.

Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a  
"cold" film). I do not know the reason.
When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in  
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the  
parents.

I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hear  
any broadcast,  " What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does  
it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? "  --I did  
not know how to tune a radio.
[ Depressions.]

I had a very horrible dream one night, I dreamt that I had fallen  
off a very crowded train.

When I drove partially across the country with my father. We  
stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I  
got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the  
country.

I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and  
had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me,  
played cards with other people.

A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very  
unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was  
very heavy weather then.
That I didn't take the time to make an appointment with someone.
People hunting animals.
After receiving the grade on the paper mentioned in FEAR.

The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the  
first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something  
between us would materialize.

I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and  
from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it  
came to it, I let them down.

When I slapped a nephew who did something that I considered  
wrong, and I was reprehended for this.

When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political  
reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional  
level.

I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't  
phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little  
tension which became worse.

When my boyfriend did not turn up in time as he promised he would  
be coming.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different  
city, I felt no longer "under the wing" of my parents even though  
they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I  
was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions.

In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crooky  
behaviour of dodging from Examinations.

When I decided my first marriage had ended, and left with the  
child. I felt overwhelmed by guilt as I was separating mother and  
child.

Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did  
not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her  
dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the  
consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had  
done it.

I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good  
and had a bad smell.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the  
Zambia closed badminton championships.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends  
of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things  
wrong.
Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody.

I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to  
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my  
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was  
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
I felt joy when I entered at the University.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love  
in an abominable way.
When my husband quarrelled with me for no reason at all.

When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to  
the girl's secondary school.

When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving  
through a puddle of water.

Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire  
vehicle.
Looking for the toilet in a dark place.

It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered  
that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room  
which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would  
refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining  
bathroom switched on.
When my first child was born.
Something was stolen.

When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling  
light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became  
unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The  
feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.

When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been  
raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.
Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.
When someone I know was caught in an "adultery" situation.

I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident  
but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my  
brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it  
impossible that had driven the car.

Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me  
emotionally.

When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a  
very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.

Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because  
I needed it myself.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned  
my love.
When the gear broke on my car.

When I was starting in romance with my husband, we went out to  
curt, and we stayed in the car "making love". At the time I was  
seventeen and I was very immature until a day I lost my  
virginity.

A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising  
loans from my friends.

After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and  
had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly  
I felt peace and joy.

My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a  
coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.

When given responsibility to grade papers in elementary school, I  
cheated a little and graded my own higher.

The day I was to receive my gold-medal for the M.A, my  
grandmother, who I loved very much, died after an illness.  She   
died a few hours before the convocation.  While I was  
attending the convocation I had to control my grief as she would  
not have liked me to miss it.  It was a day she had been waiting  
for, but did not get to see.
When I passed an exam.
When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.
When I bought new clothes and put them on.

Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured  
for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War  
II.

My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch  
back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.

When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt    
him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that  
he would be blind, fortunately he recovered after 15 days.
In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the  dark.

When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as  
most people in my surroundings.

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my  
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly  
she did not give up for a longer time.

One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange  
people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then  
came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters.  
After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because  
of indifference or cowardice.

The shame came when I was beaten by my teacher at school in front  
of boys and girls some of whom were my friends and a girlfriend  
apart from being classmates.

I saw a bag on the street and just then a stranger passed by.  I  
picked up the bag immediately and gave it to the stranger as I  
thought that it belonged to him.  But it was not his bag and I  
felt ashamed.
Participating in a theft several years ago.

I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a  
NH Competition and I was the first.
A party I went to last Christmas.

When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology  
student.

When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about  
getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found  
that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately,  
could jump for joy.

My father accused my brother of having bumped his car, and it was  
wrong.

One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger  
brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and  
wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I  
pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the  
two of us.

In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat  
people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for  
his family and himself.

I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a  
short only knocked at the window whispering that I should open  
for him.

When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with  
a rugby tour of South Africa.

When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of  
the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.
My son was born.

Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day  
before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt  
very sad at loosing a close friend.

My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her  
cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred.  
 Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a  
cafeteria.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me  
and he lost it.

During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown   
was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a  
machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

I do not have the time for other people's problems.  My  
mother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time,  
the desire or the strength to help.
Losing my temper with my spouse.

I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a  
horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was  
that I was practically obliged to eat.

When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had  
guns.

My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so  
frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments.   
I was very sad when I learnt this.

I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free  
University in Driebergen.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very  
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money  
for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the  
inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen  
from me.

Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband.  
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station  
at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and  
the government decided to delay it for another year. When my  
father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt  
that a stranger was in my house.

When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment  
concerning pensions.
When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make  
them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I  
wish there could be some other way of acting.

I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for  
them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and  
returned them.

I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, and  
caused her trouble.

I do not like one of our neighbours as they are very selfish.   
Whenever they want something or need help they come to see us,   
otherwise they do not even bother about people who live next to  
them.

One summer when I was camping with friends they devised and  
elaborate plan to scare me by having our camp attecked by a wild  
animal (one of them) and then convincing the campground was  
the home of a satanic organization.

I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small  
part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward  
when I had to show what I had prepared.

I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel  
which was filled with blood of pigs.

When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take  
things out of it.
When I was chased by a big dog near my house.

I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not  
progressing.

When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had  
commited a grave sin.
Was nearly knocked down by a car.
Quarrelled with my younger brother.
When I failed the grade seven exams.
When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.

I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but  
actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a  
full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see  
me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town.  
Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got  
impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone  
skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment  
to be able to see her.
I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.

Borrowing a car, and then having a minor accident (breaking a  
headlight).

When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me  
that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.
I feel ashamed when I am praised.
Misunderstood by friends.

The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if  
 all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the  
influence of the beer.

Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I  
would win , but at last I lost the game.

Last night I did not do very well in one of the subjects.  Before  
the result was announced I feared that I would fail.  Finally I  
got a D and as the results of the other subjects were not all       
good I felt a little sad.

The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had  
been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my  
wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked  
me the reason for my absence.

A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy  
who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was  
also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend  
of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and  
depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.
I was "best man" at my brother's wedding a year ago.

I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to  
pick me up from work.

I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was  
annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening  
and the night I frequently felt anxious.
When I failed the M.S.C exams.

I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I  
realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because  
of my boyfriend.

When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had  
soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want  
to see the blood stains.
Saw a snake unexpectedly.

I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by my  
boyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for his  
falsity.

I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better  
appearance.

When the teacher asked me a question, I did not know the answer  
and I just stood still for about a few minutes without saying a  
word.

My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop  
despite my asking her to do so.

When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on  
account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at  
secondary school.

When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and  
this was obvious to a third pereson.
When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.

Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian  
Olympic.

When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had  
got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and  
was experimenting with drugs.

When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying  
that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to  
shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they  
suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.

My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just  
seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so  
important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed  
the call and had to call her back that afternoon.

At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love  
with a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beat  
the girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.

When being illoyal (disloyal) to people close to me. Had such an  
episode with my sister, who should have received my support and  
attention.

On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to  
be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of  
her behaviour and paranoia.
When a group of friends began to make critics about me.

Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was  
really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so,  
because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to  
feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at his  
handlebar.
When the morning newspaper has not arrived.

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one  
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told  
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and  
threatened me.
The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.
When I failed the grade seven examination.
When I passed the 12th standard board exams.

Mr C took my drawing pens, without having asked for my permission  
first, and lost them.  He did not tell me about it till I asked  
him and then did not try to find them.

When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city, 
came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a  
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

Finding out from this lecture that China is backward in  
psychology.

My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the  
teacher.

When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and  
bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and  
didn't want to talk to me any more.

I felt disgust when I saw a drunkard vomiting very offensive  
matter.
I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.
Good news about a sick relative.

Seeing a close friend who had just returned from twelve months  
overseas.
When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. I  
got a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to a  
place were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rang  
and a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.

Heard some postgraduate students talking about girls being  
unsiutable to do medicine.
When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love  
with me.

I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if  
I was a rare specimen.

In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between  
my group and the graduation commission (two students of my  
classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about  
them.

My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her  
chatting with another guy.
When I was told that the form five results were out.
When I saw the movie "Poltergist".

I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively  
well prepared.

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.   
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out  
well and we enjoy ourselves.

When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.   
Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy  
substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of  
cider and threatened to throw it at me.

A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while  
the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair,  
he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.

I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look  
while his sister was raped.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother  
who had passed away about a month ago.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.
Getting into this university to do medicine.

The curriculum of the year !   The English course was very heavy.  
 I had not prepared and the teacher asked several questions  
during class.  The students were not ready to answer the  
questions and the teacher was frustated.

Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me  
when I was not responsible for the theft.

When I saw a lady putting on a pair of trousers, I felt it was a  
disguise according to Malawi culture.
Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.
When India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.

Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental  
rest. Staff on your return query your "sickness" - it is easier  
in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons  
etc.

At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and  
the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression  
on me.
Before an examn.

When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.   
The store then contacted my parents.

A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being  
clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally  
graphic.
B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima  
calling for her mother.

On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a "charming" old saleswoman came  
to beg a drink for herself.

When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why,  
I accepted to do the test for army.

Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed  
with a stranger.

I spent a lovely relaxing evening with my boyfriend. We played  
games and talked all evening.

I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having  
an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because  
my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.

The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in  
English.

When I gave water to the plants of a friend. Then one plant fell  
over, and a little statue broke. I, of course, had to tell him  
everything.

When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my  
parents.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could  
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the  
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it  
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home  
she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her  
boyfriend.

I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped all  
my papers.

When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long  
time, would come and see me.

I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the  
steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in  
front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I  
was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this  
ability that counts when choosing the winning side.

I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where  
there were many people walking by.
I asked someone to go out and she accepted right away.

Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact  
with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to  
Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt  
shamed when I finally confronted her again.

When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and  
myself.

When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been  
careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary  
mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that it  
was true.  In the past I would have at least 80% marks.  Was I  
getting weaker at studies ?  This made me feel that I should not  
expect too much from going to the university.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused  
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.
Getting ill.

When criticizing something about a person and then realizing that  
the person whom one is talking to is similar.

When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank  
and danced.

When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having  
touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every  
one read it and started teasing me about it.

I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop.   
He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.

I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality -  
one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls  
and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would  
ignore the others.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a  
lot for it.
Finding out about Chinese money cannot buy foreign journals.

I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and  
attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she  
was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.

The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student  
allowances in 1984.

Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the  
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for  
someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girls    
of my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.

I am not good enough to join any team to play sport for the  
class.
When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.

One of my class-mates had a disease unexpectedly, he had been in  
a coma for six days in a hospital before he died.

Power cut made me unable to listen to the songs sung by my  
favourite pop star.

When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and was  
studying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.

I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an  
old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.

A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the  
class during a tough mathematics examination.

When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer  
hunter")

When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was  
filled with fear.
[ When some people act very important in any situation.]
Boyfriend "chatting up" another girl.

I read in the newspaper about a 21 yr. old woman who was found  
naked and dead along a roadside. It turned out she had had two  
relatives 14 and 19 who were kidnapped, raped and killed earlier.

I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8  
exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my  
birthday.

When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to  
listen to me.

A tiresome person held me up all day long.  I was very busy then  
(I can not remember what the problem was).  He continously tried  
to make me talk to him and disturbed me.

When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and  
it was split into several segments by something I could not see.   
I suspected that it was witch-craft.
Before I moved away from home, I feared leaving.

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could  
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was  
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

Someone told me that I was chosen for English lectures because  
the class leader is going out with me (not true).

I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did  
not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed  
me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.

When I went to a halloween party and had to walk through a shopping  
center dressed like a witch.

I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for  
special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the  
first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that  
I had forgotten.

[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes  
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the  
same that one meets in the morning.]

One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a  
man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and  
asked me to cure him myself.

When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked.  
This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I had  
killed the baby.

In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of  
view is completely disregarded.

Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going  
different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total  
when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

One day I was with my girlfriend and other friends were behind  
us, I fell down because the place was slippery and I really felt  
ashamed.

I once got a phone call stating "one of your friend is in jail,  
please come and see him".  When I went to the jail and saw him, I  
was disgusted.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football  
and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought  
our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no  
one expected we would win.

One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On  
the way I met my friends and they told me that two people had  
died because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.

I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with  
either of them, so I had to change my plans.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally  
demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was  
so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the  
scene of the accident.

The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C  
junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip  
together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was  
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as  
a failure.
When a close friend died.
I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.
Being told that I have not got a personality.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary  
school leaving certificate exam.
When people next to me play the fool.

I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this  
has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.
My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.

I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A  
few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out  
of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my  
budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.

The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principal  
threatened me that I was going to be expelled.

When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he  
didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long  
time embarrassing herself.

You may find out that I am stupid and not to let me do your  
experiment.
When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very  
funny.

When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and     
his skin came peeling off.

Got a package from my parents, without even a small note  
enclosed.

When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this  
person.
When my elder sister died.

In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when  
I thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.
Not to have studied enough when exams were near.

When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on  
a close relative of mine.
When the robbers broke in, at night.

My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of  
others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be  
done by me.

The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the  
driver made the same excuse every day.
When my sister broke my china tea set.
Before an examination.

Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of  
someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.
Being together with my best friend.
When one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.
Staying alone in the biology building after the dark.

Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only  
thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking  
only about himself.

When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without  
any result.

My mother told my uncle who is a Roman Catholic Priest  
(Redemptist Father) that I had been living in a de-facto  
relationship for three years. He was very, very angry at me.

A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to  
do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic  
purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as  
soon as I finished the procedure.
When my car suddenly broke down !

A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in  
England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it      
showed that she still remembered me.

I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly  
suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She  
mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night  
because he thought I could dance with my friends who were  
friendly.
When someone chased me from his house.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my  
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that  
the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country.  
I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.

Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at  
University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my  
parents' expectations.
I was told that a friend of a friend committed suicide.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably  
angry.
Being sexually assulted on a bus.
When my grandmother passed away.

An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their  
accounts bureau.  They needed "clever people" and he had  
"immediately thought of me."

When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he  
no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.

I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day  
journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and  
tiring.

When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he  
was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no  
apparent reason.
Because I had not studied.

When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me  
for a very long time.

A female classmate was always late for meetings which were for  
the homework and not social gatherings.  We were very busy and  
the deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or an  
hour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.

Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an  
expected miscarriage.

I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the  
librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other  
colleague asked for it she gave it to him.

I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood  
I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).
Insulted by somebody.

I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a  
science class here.

When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their  
behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like  
the windows, glasses etc.

When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else  
whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had  
happened (my sister).

During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the  
subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.
My class winning against another class in a football match.

Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an  
entire packet of almonds I had bought for a family treat.

I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend  
not to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she got  
informed about it. I felt very ashamed.
When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as  
having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition  
of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad  
event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to  
stay with him in the hospital.

Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only  
spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband  
for 3 months.

In a park near our home, a group of young people who were  
strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They  
began to eat while carressing each other.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had  
to learn all on my own.

They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some  
awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of the  
fight, I feel guilty.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of  
Zambia.
Having been angry and unpleasant towards my parents.
An unjust calumny concerning me.

I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down,  
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about  
me.
Peeping.

We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and  
suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My  
friend had to turn the car rapidly.

When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a  
group.

My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km  
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough  
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there  
once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel  
guilty.

At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary  
student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel  
very happy.

At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new  
trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the  
trousers again.

I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep  
some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep,  
but the teacher told me to do it.

After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt  
shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of  
the results of the midterm.

My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something  
which was serious and a real burden to me.
Finding out my grades at the end of my Sophomore year.
When one of my friends started misbehaving.
Slaughtering of animals.

This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards  
anyone.

A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a  
wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an  
invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all  
my empathy.
With an alcoholic.

Someone told me he was chosen for the English lectures because he  
was a good friend of the class leader.

A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking  
for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had  
certainly happened to her.
Anatomy lesson and told we have to do it at night sometimes.

This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from  
the pot.
When I failed the  grade 7 exams.
Not being able to be selected for the dancing team.

After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount of  
sudying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activities  
which come up.

The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in  
it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed  
to us that this was almost impossible to happen.

The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog  
which lives in my street.
I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time  
and I had lost his address and telephone number.

I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the  
gutter, in broad daylight.

I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly  
studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I  
hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension  
between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had  
of me !

I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I  
was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my  
friend.  That day I was really sad.
When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boy  
although it was finished already 3 months before. That person  
seriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then I  
felt very miserable because I had told lies.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not  
study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult  
test.

On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just  
with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling  
overwhelmed.
I like someone who does not like me and was rude to me.
When I found that my coldness had hurt somebody's sincerity.

People having a football match outside the window during the  
lecture.

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my  
parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

When I didn't pass the examinations for FUVEST I felt myself  
guilty for I should have studied. I had the opportunities, and  
I drew them out.

When I was a teacher in an evening school, a girl raised a lot of  
questions and expressed her opinions.  She, very often, took a  
stand which was different from mine and she thought that it  
was better than mine.  Her opinions were helpful academically, but   
she did not take into consideration my position in public.  Also  
she seemed to be very talkative and so she disgusted me.
Said something I should not have said in public.

I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs  
who were all fighting and going against what they would say was  
good.

In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (a  
friend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me and  
said that he would tear up my answer sheet.  I got very angry  
with the girls involved.

The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the  
relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me.  
And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
My mother's death.
When India first won the world cup cricket tournament.

When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school  
that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous  
day.
[ The day I have not worked (academic) hard enough.]
Had an insulting letter from my father.
A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.

I worked with several classmates on a project.  I was very  
anxious about the project while my partners showed no concern   
and when we had meetings on the project my classmates  did not  
pay any attention.  Some of them read books while the others  
argued on irrelevant questions.  The meeting would go on for two  
hours without the main theme being discussed.  We wasted time and  
could not reach a compromise.  My classmates avoided doing the  
work and the responsibilities, they seemed to value other  
projects more than this one.

I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least  
expecting it.

My classmate at TISS has the habit of biting his nails and ever  
since my childhood I have never liked this habit.  This person is  
near me in class, dining hall and the campus so I suggested that  
he should stop biting his nails.  However he found it difficult  
and my disgust feelings have not changed.

A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I  
didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

Making an unexpected talk with a professor in the canteen. This  
made me shy.

When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I  
always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid  
telling them what happened to me.
Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.

My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used  
to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The  
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The  
other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In  
fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone  
in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next  
to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to  
commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of  
the irritation.
