When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I  
felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family  
and then I learned slowly to understand to life.
Getting the top price in the football pools.

Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the  
deliberation not the provocation.

When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad  
things that I had been saying about them.

Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who  
had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the  
place.
When out of work.

I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and  
suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any  
comment I added to our chatting.

One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump  
of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I  
thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he  
did not and he put it in his mouth.

When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to  
wait outside the ward.
When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
Bad food in the students' dining hall.
[ While approaching to test the situation.]

A friend and I were going to have a study session together in  
which we quiz ourselves in biology material. Because I believed I  
didn't study enough. I feared I would fail.
When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.

A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my  
fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.

At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village,  
about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no  
bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not  
identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as  
there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.
When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the  
road, and I had transgressed (together with the "wild" kids from  
across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near  
our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I  
was severely scolded.

When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and  
urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad  
would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and  
asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him  
anything.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules  
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my  
own feet.
Finished a difficult midterm.
Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.

At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly  
harmed.
A girl I love does not love me.

When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep  
the child away from the fire.

The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.   
It was so filthy that it really made me sick.

I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move with  
failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no  
lady can refuse our proposal.
I lost a close friend.
When I left my part-time job.

At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two  
people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and  
discriminating.
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]

I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in  
a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very  
dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I  
could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I  
waited for dawn.

Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road  
at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over  
onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the  
truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.

I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when  
I called out loudly.
Close friends talking badly of other friends.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance  
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his  
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the  
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old  
he was (79).

I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.  When I  
entered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmates  
made me feel guilty.

When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badly  
embarrassing him without reason.

I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I  
was within the row of students who were making noise.

I am afraid of my academic results as I will face several  
problems.  I am scared of my limitations and the unlimited  
problems and I do not know how to cope with them.
When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.

In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass  
two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned  
myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these  
examinations.
It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.

When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run  
in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could  
see was this hand coming towards me.

Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did  
not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in  
her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

When I found out that a person I went to school with had died in  
a car accident.
Made a mistake at work.

I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no  
work, only loneliness.
Disgust with drunk people.

I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone  
else.

An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to  
spend spare time were disapproved.

My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is  
right.

A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had  
circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the  
seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain        
derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this     
would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of   
the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch  
if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming  
was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.

My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for  
himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as  
we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an  
unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't  
jailed.

My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank  
an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did  
not understand that he had done anything wrong.

When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit  
down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally  
desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not  
finished.

My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I  
prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).

When I saw a girl in my economics discussion section smiling and  
asking stupid questions to the TA. just to get attention. She was  
obviously ass-kissing. It happens in every Econ. discussion held  
weekly.

Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship  
football final.
One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me  
with the boy who is my best friend.
When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would  
have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and  
could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would  
understand this as they had always done).  They did not  
understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many  
other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.

I was away to school (Primary). In my abscence my young brother  
at home got sick suddenly. My parents took him to hospital. On  
the way he died. It came to me as a sad, sudden and shocking  
news and I felt very sad.

When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a  
foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and  
tried to "catch me".

I feared that I would not be able to hand in the book-report on  
time as I had started working very late.  The book was difficult  
to read and my teacher did not accept my work as it was handed in  
late.

Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I  
thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.
After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)  
cigarettes.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.

I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of  
Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !

When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died  
after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely  
person and I did not have the means for his company.

My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out with  
him.

A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the  
supervisor did not like me.

My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him  
away, and they later contacted his parents.

When my husband discovered I was having an affair with another  
man.
Saw a man dressed as a woman.

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends  
whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years  
previously.

I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are my  
parents. As the relationship developed I found it harder and  
harder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship.  
He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square.  
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I  
went into the role of a performing clown.
When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.

No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resulting  
in someone else being blamed for the event.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long  
time.

Once, before I had learnt to swim, I stepped on a slippery slope  
where there was a lot of moss and I slipped into the water.  The  
water was very deep and I could not stand on my feet.  I sank  
and had to use a lot of energy.

I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I  
have done things good in relation to other people especially when  
my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

When I was going to bring back my girlfriend to LA to meet my  
parents.
An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.

When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked,  
because there where persons that didn't have problems, and  
wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by  
co-owners out of pure selfishness.

When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people.  
When they do not understand what I say.

A few days back I was waiting for the bus at the bus stop.   
Before getting into the bus I had prepared the exact amount of  
coins to pay for the bus fair and when I got into the bus I put  
these coins into the box meant to collect the bus fair.  I  
thought that I had paid and wanted to get inside.  However the  
bus driver called me and asked me in an impolite way if the coins  
were stuck at the opening  of the box.  He had not seen me paying  
and there wasn't a stack of coins in the box.  I could not  
understand this and the driver kept questioning me.  He made me  
feel angry and at last i inserted a dollar coin in the box just  
to get away from him.  Later I found that I had forgotten a few  
coins in my pocket and had not paid enough for the fair the first  
time.  After I had entered the bus I could still hear him  
scolding me and I felt disgusted.

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to  
remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was  
that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad  
me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I  
had trusted her.

Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied  
at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend  
went to Greece for a holiday for a month.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.

When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The  
notification came by post.

While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room  
and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my  
roommate.

I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised  
that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel  
ashamed.

My nephew is a deaf and also "hyperactive" boy. I had been  
responsible for looking after him for a full day, and was very  
tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the  
leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain.

The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting  
on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help  
blushing.

I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a  
social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear  
was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I  
saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.

One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my  
kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french  
windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were  
coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves  
outside.

I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid  
trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.

Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was  
cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident  
that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
Saw a beggar on the street (China still so poor).
Watching TV about china is behind in winning gold medals.

During a recent meeting, Mr. A showed his excitement and  
overindulged in the notes delivered.  Though his curiosity could  
not be blamed, his way of accquiring knowledge was an extreme  
behaviour e.g he always tried to know what I was reading and  
gained everything he could.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was  
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing  
him because he is so dear to me.
After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.
I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I have  
happened to deceive them over some trifling things.

Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the  
present point in time in outrageous activity.

It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this  
Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some  
unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
When a close relative is treated badly.

Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly  
tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were "pissed  
off".
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.

During one year my mother almost had a nervous breakdown and my  
father had a serious operation. I was afraid that our family (4  
kids, I'm the oldest) wouldn't hold together. Everything turned  
out fine.

I felt the emotion when I fought somebody who was drunk and tried  
to disturb us while we were having meals.

In a day when at work, in school, and relationships came out as I  
wanted, and I was recognized in my work.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog  
standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how  
it would react later on.

I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered or  
purified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.
My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.

I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to  
visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was  
very different from what I expected.

I had been away all night without having told my parents about  
it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.   
She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that  
she was angry and disappointed.

After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to  
buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my  
mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I  
did not known about it and so was all the more glad.

I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew  
that I would never see them again.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it  
impossible to continue discussing.

I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I  
had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I  
did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not  
sing.
During my childhood I once lied and my sister found out.

I was disgusted the other day I was told to take off the dog's  
faeces around the house since they smelled bad I did the job but  
in the end I felt disgusted.

Some people whom I do not like at all, and one of the reasons is  
their physical appearance.

When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an  
impulsive kiss.
When I did not get the compound which is known.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up  
on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two  
mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good,  
it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.

Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary  
school.

During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the  
closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary  
forces.

I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that  
a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.

I had told a person unpleasant things in a bad manner. He was  
very depressed and caused an accident.

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's  
brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes,  
mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the  
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my  
registration at UNZA.
Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.

Found out that someone I knew well has been misunderstanding me  
for 2 years.

While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and  
someone elses in a minor way.

Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to  
school back East. We are very close and have been together 4  
years.

After much trouble getting together in the first place my  
boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and  
shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the  
connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was  
drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter  
my room.

By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed  
to be loaned out.
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents  
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of  
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not  
encouraged and was rejected.

Being sexually assulted on a bus and noone helped (people only  
laughed).

I was walking along the passage to my room (very near the anatomy  
laboratory) and I heard something and felt that there was some  
thing behind me.  I looked back and there was no one.  I started  
imagining that maybe it was a corpse.

I felt sadness when I notice that I'm not important for a  
determinate person. We do many things for a friend, and we see  
soon after, that he doesn't do anything for us, nor thinks of us.

When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I  
thought that I would be found out.

My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I  
started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without  
knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it  
back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that  
it was my fault.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on  
my birthday.

My grandmother died over the summer. I knew her very well, she  
baked great biscuits. She was in the hospital but expected to  
improve and go home soon. She died in her sleep.
Succeeding in helping others.

I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had  
longed for.

When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it  
meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was  
a clear and unfair insult.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which  
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more  
money to carry on studying.

When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received  
a letter from a boyfriend.
When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize  
the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day.  
The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a  
good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the  
situation.

Finding out I am chosen to collect norms for Chinese aphasia (I  
will contribute to China's catching up with the West in  
neuropsychology).

I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I  
talked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed for  
reasons which were not known to me.
The death of a friend.

A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a  
cheap one.

I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to  
give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it  
back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so  
long.

When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not  
supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.

A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but later  
used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.
Not thanking relatives for a favor done.

One rainy day when the streets were wet, and as I was walking down  
a slope, I fell down out of my carelessness.  There were many  
people and they saw me, so I felt ashamesd.  Moreover I hurt my  
ankle and it was painful.

I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered  
me greatly.
When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

When I realized that my bathing suit was spotted, I had became  
menstruated.

I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that  
he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should  
watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through  
the room.

A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me  
from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the  
time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a  
few words.

When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had  
been on a particular occasion.

I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing  
things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.
I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.

Last Summer I went camping with some C.U students.  As I was  
working then, I had to leave the second night (some of them had  
joined us the first night).  Next morning, 6 o'clock, a female  
classmate knocked on our door and tried to wake us up.  I was not  
fully conscious and I said something which I should not have.  I  
realized the trouble I had made and wanted to hide.  Later I  
said sorry to her and the matter came to an end.
Criticized in front of the class.
Nothing.

I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in the  
entrance college examination.

I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his  
invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being  
paralysed.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in high  
school. That was my first and last time.

When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of  
yours and you are at the bottom of it.

My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of  
whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did  
something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.
That someone would discover whom I really love.

I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I  
called my mother.

When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work  
place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she told  
me that a cardriver solicited her.
Failed in a piblic argument.
When my beloved grandfather died.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants  
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and  
pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then  
they left - leaving me bleeding.
Once I answered my father rudely.

Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us  
started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180 turn we  
followed and ended up in a gully.

I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence    
70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.
Left alone in dark when young.

I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of  
our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her  
pregnancy.

When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three  
years.
Not helping other people to do their homework.

During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering  
with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for  
him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and  
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.
On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.
My best friend was not chosen for the English lectures.

Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?)  
meeting.

When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder  
I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied  
that the ladder was not very stable.

A close friend of mine was leaving for graduate school out of  
state. I had arranged to gather some people together the day  
before he left to be with him and have a good time, but I didn't  
pay as much attention to him as I should have.

I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in  
Nijmegen where I study.
Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by  
motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did  
not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for  
anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said  
something like that).
My being admitted to UNZA.

Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend  
came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she  
thought I was still interested in the boy.

When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in  
Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues  
to complete an assignment.

When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the  
teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working  
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at  
the Higher Agricultural Institute.
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I  
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of  
Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded  
to play it very well.

One day I was the leader of the weekly meeting of the Church  
fellowship.  That day I had been preparing for the exams and did  
not estimate the time to travel to the church right and I was  
twenty minutes late.  As I had not prepared well I led the  
meeting badly.  I was ashamed of myself.

When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me  
with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students  
laughed at me.

Waiting for the results of the High level examination.  I was  
afraid of not being accepted.

When someone made me a compliment after an examination just at  
the moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.

I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of  
different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as  
a person but could not agree with the life the future would  
demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got  
very angry.

I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean  
the place where the vomit was.
A theft committed by me.
When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment  
of one's personality.
After my father's death.
I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.

When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My  
father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life.  
 I really felt like hiding.
When my father died.
The birth of my first child.

I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when  
Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I  
expected, I wanted some Disco records.

When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the  
neighbours boys their mother caught us.
Always when I meet the person I love.
When I got through the first day here at the department.

When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A  
subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and  
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many  
bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the  
girls who did him wrong.
When I robbed a loop in supermarket.
When I got a record as a gift from a friend.

When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 years  
old.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

I was very scared at the time of the Ty.B.Sc examination as I had  
decided to get 1st class results.  I was afraid thinking of how  
the papers would be.
Could not buy a reference book because I got up too late to cue.

I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering with  
some electrical applainces.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some  
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything   
was all right.

I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could  
not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew  
about the story.

I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a  
friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my  
boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting.  
After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell  
him that.

Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him  
very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the  
hunter who shot him.

When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his  
parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.
I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to  
school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting  
them down, disappointing them.
When I could study at university.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost  
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the  
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I  
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to  
me, of the unknown.

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my  
girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend  
in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I  
threw stones at him and he ran away.

This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to  
fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted  
my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money  
which was just like a miracle to me.

I was sad when I heard that my cousin died because of being  
bewitched by her husband's second wife.
When I moved away from home.

In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I  
was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of  
the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling  
myself mass of maneuver.
When I triffled with other people.

My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time.  
She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the  
relationship without going out with other people. I was her first  
boyfriend.

When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on  
my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.

My sister forgot to bring presents for my birthday, I was rude to  
her.

In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who  
practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was  
swimming.

When I was informed that a short story I had written had been  
accepted for publication.

Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to  
feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.
A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another  
friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they  
kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried  
to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay  
me much attention.

When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the  
road.

I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at  
first he had said that he would not do that.
When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).
When a friend of mine visited me and my house was in a mess.
I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.
When they tried to rob me.

Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a  
disco.

Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We  
told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny  
noises. I was terribly frightened.
Not doing well in an examn.

When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and  
the bus leaned against a wall.

When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother  
discovered that.

As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being  
set upon by another boy who claimed it was "his land" - being  
intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc.
A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.

A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from  
his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.
I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.

After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed  
and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to  
answer in the presence of the patients.

I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who  
wanted to talk to me.
A tailor ran away with my skirt.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to  
was very negative and not very helpful.

When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which  
was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were   
not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the   
house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more  
frightening.

It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just  
because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.

The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I  
was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.

I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the  
same day).

When I crashed by bike into an old lady crossing a road and  
knocked her down.
You told me psychology can help people to be happier.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.

When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results  
in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize.

I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy  
held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my  
friend.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my  
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory  
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had  
died recently.

The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I  
had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare   
for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would   
not be able to finish it.

A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange  
manner.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before,  
did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half  
a year later.

I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of  
his mouth while speaking.
Telling a lie.

When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises  
without permisssion and at the wrong time.

Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth.  
They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve  
weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I  
needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather  
in the open sea.

When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school,  
I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail,  
but it appeard that we both had passed.

I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She  
started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.

When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to,  
and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have prepared  
was not there.

When Dad went to a Sports Day and was the only parent there, and  
he was cheering for us.
When I took drugs.
Not doing well in the examn.
Not having good marks like other people for homeworks.

When an uncle of mine who is very ill started to cough wich  
sounded very dirty. (He can't help it of course).
A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.

When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for  
her all night, not knowing where she was.
When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.
A boy who shot dead a squirrel.

When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a  
possible failure.
Finding out that my best friend was deceiving me.
Staying alone in the dark.
Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.

A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about  
3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night,  
and back again.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.
When my first love was not successful.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath  
outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the  
first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from  
PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my  
protestation was obvious to me.
When planning to marry.

I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I  
was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in  
the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and  
didn't get approved.

After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to  
fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the  
pole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I tried  
to drive home from his house.

One of those days when I was going to school with my brother and  
he annoyed me.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by  
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally  
spoiled my New year's night.

I was eating in a very nice restaurant, when the servant asked  
whether I liked the food I told him that I liked it but that  
there was one thing which wasn't so good. The servant than worked  
very hard to make it good.
Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.
Someone messing up the room we share.
In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very  
much about what had been said or done during the party on the  
previous night.
When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.

My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our  
childhood, and we had a very happy time.

A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did  
not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly  
thereafter.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a  
restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without  
finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up  
the idea.
As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with me  
till she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me.   
She behaved life a really selfish person.
When I won a tennis match.

The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and  
they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed  
me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left  
for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away  
was very sad.

We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started  
coughing and spitting into his plate.

When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I  
felt guilty the next day.
Fear of doing well on a midterm.

My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom  
prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and  
thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a  
woman.

When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I  
was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were  
very hard.

When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to  
be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed  
for it.

Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying  
and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very  
dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it  
was the birds till my mother told me so.

I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed my  
car and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire front  
bumper was destroyed.
When my parents complimented me very nicely on something.

When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without  
knowing the real cause of what had happened.
When someone stole my bike.

A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that  
turned into sadness-unpleasantness.

When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home  
immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have  
easily waited.

After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in  
1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the  
Examination when the results were out.

A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain  
things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an  
aggressive manner.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could  
at last be with the people I wanted to see.
Parents finding out I smoked.

I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sense  
between my parents.

At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering  
problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing  
the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of my  
autonomous nerve system (I could not help it).
When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left  
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My  
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that  
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and  
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I  
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my  
wardrobe.

One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my  
close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore  
because he was jealous.

Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the  
family when visiting.

When I got  grade "C" in M160 at the end of my first year at  
UNZA.  I had expected a "C+" or a "B" as M160 is easy, going by my  
capacity in mathematics.
Someone called me a disgusting nickname.

When I was in F4 I led my class to a riot.  However the form  
master said that my conduct was good and asked me to tell him the  
names of those who had taken part in it.   I replied that I did  
not know.

I was jerking me off in my bedroom, when suddenly, my mother came  
in. She looked at me and immediately left the room.
Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.

I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the  
standard 8 exams for the third time.

Once while playing tennis with my classmate I lost a few tennis  
balls.  I found one near the tennis court and took it to be mine  
despite thinking that it might belong to the student in the next  
court.  I felt guilty.  Later someone came to me to claim the  
ball and I gave it back to him.

I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and  
some pieces broke off when the plug dropped off my hands.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We  
became reconciled.

When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from  
furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and  
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.
Saw Chinese people flattering foreigners.

In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other  
during the agitation.

I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year  
degree exams.

A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke my  
father's antique lamp.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there  
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the  
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for  
one question (the question was graded by the professor and he  
indicated he liked my answer).

My third grade teacher caught me cheating on a spelling test. I  
couldn't spell Australia and she said in a loud voice something  
like "We don't have cheaters in my class".

Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them  
would be killed.

When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was  
rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the  
year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M.,  
somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours,  
and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach,  
painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.

When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any  
water for two days.
My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.

I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the  
shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an  
old man when I was in those shoes.
When I failed two subjects last year.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

Suddenly found out that I was the lasr one to leave the anatomy  
room.

I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition.  
 In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored   
the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell  
down.

I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell  
the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by  
it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we  
had the apartment.

The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do  
as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared  
with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the  
person was listening.

Having failed to help with the 5th of March arrangements (Women's  
Day), although I had previously promised to take part in the  
work.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our  
relationship due to some circumstances between her and her  
family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any  
reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This  
was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I  
thought about what had happened.

This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my  
trousers without my consent.

I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music  
was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed  
on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre  
that was almost empty.
Walking out from the biology building.

On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It  
stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it  
but I was very frightened.

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something  
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not  
serious and I need not worry.
When I passed my B.A exams.
Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.

I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words  
at a man without any reason whatsoever.

When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit  
me.

I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I would  
hurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we had  
created.

When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus  
including me in the "family war".

This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him  
with a certain boy.

It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car  
accident.
When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.

When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially  
prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely  
unfair accusations of a large group of people.

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and  
wine.

A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.   
Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to  
finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to  
veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.

When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen  
road.

I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects  
and I found that I had failed it.

I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told  
that my mother had skin cancer and would have to go to the hospital  
straight away.
When I saw a horrible movie - Alien.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite  
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory  
which he himself had never known. His information was from  
fortuitous sources.

One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as I  
had finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reason  
why he came in.

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he  
knows needs doing.

When I confessed to my girl-friend (now my wife) that I had  
betrayed her with another woman.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many  
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to  
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any  
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

One night I could not practise my violin as my family was  
watching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to some  
tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch,  
however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin  
on the floor.
When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.

I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some soft  
music from my three band radio cassette.  There was only young  
Kaley there and he explained, " Your aunt has sold it as she  
wanted to buy clothes."

In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for  
money.  Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told me  
that I was really good-looking.  A man who was in front of me  
also turned to look at me.

The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year  
at UNZA, school of medicine.

I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let  
me go out alone for the first time.

I had not studied very much for my final examination at school,  
so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral  
examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I  
heard that I had passed it.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.

I am happpy when I get good results in the field of academics or  
athletics.

I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing  
regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never  
be able to row again.

I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was  
immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without  
doing anything to help.

When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of  
separation.
Saw someone acting in a false manner in public.

A teacher spent a lot of time helping me without wanting to be  
paid for it. For the exam I didn't got a good grade and I felt  
ashamed.

When I found my boyfriend, who I had been dating for a year, at  
another girl's house. We had had previous conflicts concerning  
the girl, but he had always claimed they were just friends.
Not doing well in examns which I should do well (English examns).

When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a  
car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my  
form five exams with flying colours.

When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be  
forced to marry her or go to court.
Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.

When I learnt that a friend of mine had talked about me to  
another friend and had said wrong things about my abilities and  
attitudes.  I was very angry.
The death of my twin sister - suicide.
When I heard that I had been selected for the university.
A fear of lack of personal powers.
When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to "be free".   
He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.

When my parents-in-law scolded me, without any reason, in front of the  
other members of my family for the first time.  They had called  
me from my room where I had been studying for my exams.
The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.

I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are  
pregnant illegitimately.

When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came  
out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.
[ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]

We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the  
wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove  
down a precipice.
Criticized by a teacher in public.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They  
were special people to me.

Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the best  
present I can give to my father.

Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being  
prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20  
others.

My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which had  
melody but had no content.  We lived together so when he played  
the recorder I was forced to listen to them.  I could not tell  
him that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no right  
to disturb the freedom of others.  So I would find a pretext to  
leave the room and go somewhere else.
When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while  
visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an  
hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door  
between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.

When a "friend" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know  
what it was.
Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.

Adolescent guilt growing up feeling "bad, immoral" sexual  
desires, some 10yrs ago.

The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a  
black rubbish bag.

My father promised to send me pocket money at the month-end since  
I wanted to buy a new pair of shoes when I was at secondary  
school, but he didn't.

When I got low marks in the final year B.Sc exams, I felt guilty  
as I had not worked hard because I had been roaming around with my  
 friends.
When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.

I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi  
and when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink on  
the side.
When I learnt that I had been betrayed by my friend.

My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my  
place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had  
come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind  
me.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and  
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until  
several weeks later.

Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death,  
etc.
After an argument with a friend of mine.
When my family allowed me to do higher studies.

The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my  
parents would further do to distroy my relationship.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste  
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological  
investigation and then I got really angry.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small  
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and  
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had  
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

One day, when I realized that I was alone, I felt fear of  
loneliness.

I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked  
if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.

I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others.  
My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.

When I was little I lost control of my bike and started to go  
into a buay intersection but my neighbor stopped me just in time.

When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a  
stranger.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not  
seen for some time

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and  
war.

One night we were having a barbecue on the beach and I needed to  
go to my car, which was far away from the beach.  It was very  
dark as there were no street lamps.  I ran in the dark, very  
scared, I ran as fast as possible.

When some housemen told me a young girl like you should not be  
allowed to lecture to consultants, I was too shy to argue against  
them.

We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in  
the air, and it bounced on an expensive table and damaged the  
table .The person did not apologise.

At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal  
for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she  
refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.   
It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and  
the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.

In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing  
with his penis in the middle of the town.

My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was going  
for surgery, I was afraid he might not come back to life after  
hearing of the General Anaesthesia.

During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I  
wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese  
and his opinion was right of course.
I had just masterbated with another boy.

When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact  
with my parents.

I was supposed to go out with my girlfriend one Saturday night,  
but I got really drunk with some friends earlier that afternoon  
and evening. So, I totally forgot about going out with my  
girlfriend. She showed up the next day, and that was when I  
remembered.

When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six  
years, came back home safe and in good health.
Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
I allowed my then boyfriend to touch me, if only briefly.
While dancing in a restaurant last week.
I confused a girl with another.
Someone not responding to my criticism.
When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.

When somebody I knew greeted me and started to talk with me and I  
didn't know, I couldn't remember who he was.

A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always  
tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.

When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic  
accident.

Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something  
funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's  
face.
I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.

My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc.   
She treated us strictly and punished us physically.   These  
things were intolerable.

I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber  
in my cup.

No ideal result in the University entrance examn, guilty to  
family and friend.

I asked someone to bring some present to my father and found out  
that he is not a reliable person. I was afraid if my father would  
not get the presents he would be angry with me.
This situation occurred when I entered into a smelling ward.

This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my  
friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by  
three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel  
for one year.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not  
act very responsibly and one of them was injured.

It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for  
two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

When I saw a film where a black was rapeing a girl while another one was  
filming it for a pornographic movie.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.

When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started  
the process of breaking up.

I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived  
them.

When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school  
(with success).

Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends  
quarelled.

When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using  
tear gas and started intimidating the students without any  
provocation.
Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.

Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and  
in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a  
bird-cage, killing it.
A relative not acting on her promise.
A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the  
last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person -  
fear came.

My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she  
committed last night.

It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was  
going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.

When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment  
"myself" i.e on my own initiative.

My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my  
friends were attending.

Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little.  
It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.
At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.

Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned  
enough.
Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on.  
I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope  
with the radio.

When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows,  
passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was  
behind me, although I knew I was alone.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for  
the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name  
on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and   
the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and  
not only sadness.

When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I  
did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for  
several minutes.

I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I  
always started crying so that he had to give in.

When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just  
near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night.  
Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was  
fearful whenever walking through the area.

I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed  
comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year,  
unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation  
together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted  
to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out  
as we had expected it to and this saddened me.

When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of  
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found  
roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I  
called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came  
over and checked.
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.

I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car  
accident and was admitted in hospital.

This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to  
start Form I in October 1980.
When my grandmother passed away.

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been  
spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.   
I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this  
neighbour's house.
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.

Told by some people the class leader only choose his friends (not  
true).

The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt -  
disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.
When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.

Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better  
than China.

A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept  
putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for  
days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I  
felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do  
what she had requested me to do.

As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more  
the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my  
grand-father which made me sad.
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
Forgot to give a present to my little nephew.
Staying in the room alone at night.

When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a  
boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date  
a boy whom I liked for a long time.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I  
went to live in Sofia.
Afraid of a dead body.

When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip  
with my friends.
When my little sister was born.

I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or  
negative critic.

I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly  
afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the  
next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all  
night in bed without falling asleep.

I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty  
dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.

When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly  
standing waiting for a bus.
Cooks refused to give me food.
When I was given detention at secondary school.
When as an 8 year old, I wet myself in school.

Seeing a friend "making love" to a high school girl. I  
accidentally was dragged into this room where the happenings had  
occurred. I was disgusted at the reality.
Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.

I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's  
judgement and action on what I had done.

When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.   
I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed  
at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.

[ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for example  
paying bills).]

When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister,  
close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my  
father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

Too busy to write letters to friends and they said I had  
forgotten about them.
I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how  
to.

I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any more  
because of his relationship with another girl.

When I was in P3 I was always punished as I would forget to do my  
homework.  The first time that I was punished and not allowed to  
leave school, I slipped out of school.

One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who  
tried to molest me.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.
Finding out that the person I love understands me.

" I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing  
people in your room," he said.  This sentence really shot my  
heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away  
without uttering a word.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit  
suicide.

My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after  
he had drunk some beer.

I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely  
slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.

I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived  
with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.

I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I  
realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never  
see eachother again and none of it mattered.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately  
happy until a year or so ago.

One morning after breakfast I was still not satisfied.  My nephew  
(a small boy of 2) had not eaten his breakfast and just when I  
was taking a bit of his share someone walked in.
Not finishing my duty as a class leader.

I felt ashamed of my body in spite of knowing that it is more or  
less beautiful and also knowing that my boyfriend considers me  
beautiful, but this was only in the beginning.

When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young  
people approached.
When I overate at lunch.
Cueing for a bus and the drivers having long dinner.

At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my  
friend.

At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I am  
nice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.
My guilty behaviour was found out by others.

When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard  
to close friends, even in situations that those friends need  
them.

I was so sick that my relatives thought that I was bewitched.  I  
felt like dying.

A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides  
this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died  
tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad  
and couldn't believe it (until today).

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her  
and telling nice things to her.

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in  
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because  
everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous,  
and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There  
were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he  
did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us  
very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not  
to interfere with what was his buisness.
Low evaluation of other people's cares.

[ I missed my twin when I was on the verge of being thrown, which  
I disliked.]

When someone took my things without having asked for my  
permission.

One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the  
car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared  
over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and  
almost died.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was  
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because  
his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same  
for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay  
with her - still felt shame.

I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley  
one Wednesday night.
I did not deliver a message on time.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled  
out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of  
traffic lights.

I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me  
speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left,  
I did not try to prevent her from leaving.
When I met a friend of mine after several months.

I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There  
were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing  
one another and passed through the window outside the classroom.  
Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified.  
Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking  
movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the  
window.

When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we  
were on a camping.
Fight with my mate after a quarrel.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when  
I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him  
is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally  
and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need  
forgiveness.

On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, I  
became intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember the  
actual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.
Not being able to help my friend to study English.

I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in  
a fight.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.

When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the  
exams.

We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal
