this to happen and was sad for a few months.
Some boys boasting about their ability to tell dirty jokes.

A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that he  
would only come back after many years, I felt very sad.
When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.

In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried  
to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my  
sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.   
There was a fight.
When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something  
against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when  
she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.   
She had misunderstood me.
When I was treated improperly by someone.
When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.
I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.
I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.
I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.

When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,  
and his attitude made me glad.

I had a date with my girlfriend, the time and place had not been  
fixed.  I asked her to phone me an hour later as it was midnight  
and I did not want to disturb her family.  I waited several hours  
for her call, she did not call me that night.
Robbery mentioned under sadness.
Day time robbery of our house.

One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me  
only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it  
on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.
People not cueing in the college dining room.

When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a  
relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.

A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to have  
been responsible.

When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in    
a ditch with one side against a rock.
Made mistakes in exam.

A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his  
life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power  
to support his frustration and his behavioral change.

At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a  
sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off  
because he didn't like me.

Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without  
knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I  
came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents  
when I remembered how much they had done for me.

When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he  
made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

When I cheated my father and told him that the school  
administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two  
months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for  
the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again  
as he had already given it to me once.

I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to  
ask my way and I struck a parked car.

I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for  
a long time (a good letter).

I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in  
hospital.
Can't describe any disgust situation.

At night when I was alone at home (all the family members usually  
get together at that time) someone knocked vigorously on the  
door.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

When we received  our academic result I learnt that my  results  
were bad as I had not done my best.  The results of my  
accquaintances were good and when they asked me about my results  
I really did not want to answer.

I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being  
followed.

When my father passed away of cancer, I was extremely saddened.  
He was not very old, which made matters worse. The actual death  
was horrendous, but the moving funeral saddened me more so.

One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning,  
to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of  
a yield.

While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever   
and amusing sketch.

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise  
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along  
too.

When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide  
how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of  
such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she  
told me.

A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teachers  
present.

My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very  
naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and  
the person that did it got away without any punishment from the  
law.

When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was  
out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my  
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had  
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was  
very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long  
time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was a  
friend's girlfriend.

When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan  
called "The startwar".

When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the  
consequences of the Vietnam war.

Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not  
true.

As I was not paying attention, my little brother fell off the  
table.
When I shout at a colleague in classroom.

I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one  
month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.   
However, in the train my name had been omitted from the  
reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was  
alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the  
seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I  
paid money.

When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the  
floor.
When I bought my car.

I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his   
departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer  
holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the  
hospital.

This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact  
a few years ago.
Did not read reference when other people read them.

During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a  
bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place,  
afraid that the police would see me.
When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.
When a guy chased me when I was out jogging.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

When my sister's first child came home, after one week in  
intensive care at the hospital.

I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers  
dropped out.

I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had  
to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew  
that my moving was an important reason for this.

I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way.  
My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped  
my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I  
planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to  
the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my  
consent.

My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn't  
succeed a years-course.

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December  
last year.

[ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for  
some reason, fails to do it.]

[ I felt guilt when I was not co-operative with my mother for my  
exam.]
At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.
Saw a real party leader.

I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some  
fear that some men would attack me and rob me.

During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to  
commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.

I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a  
telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which  
I had been waiting.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my  
boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member  
of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but  
his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a  
radiator".
When my father passed away.

Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis  
court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk  
told me that the court was being used for lessons.

When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my  
grant was spent.
Doing poorly on a midterm.
When my mother was operated.

Some people were unfairly treated, because of their  
nationality/colour.

The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health.  
Coping.

I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most  
people performed well.
Got a present from my friend for my birthday.
When I offended my parents without wanting it.

I felt disgusted when I was in a helpless position at the loss of  
my fiancee.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose  
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a  
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not  
come out although the others did.

I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very  
bad taste.

I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it  
for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at  
myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.
An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.

I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be  
done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when  
I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my  
work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt  
ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also  
a friend of mine.

A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly  
opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike  
got caught in the tram tracks.  I somersaulted but had no  
injuries.

My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my  
friends.
When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him  
"Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry  
as he had belittled me.

This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a  
theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friend  
and we all hit eachother.

My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the  
information that she had died.

I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had  
raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.

When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat  
out of the bag.

When a person is privileged in account of situations that are  
unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for  
several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I  
had a feeling of emptyness.

I felt anger against a person who told bad things about me in my  
absence.
Postgraduate students talking about girls stupid.
I was bitten by a dog.

My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter  
addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and  
said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun  
was shining on it". Hah Hah.

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them  
in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I  
couldn't play them again.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to  
interrupt my studies.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.
When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

I felt guilty when I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe  
bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.
Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.
When I got a small present form a person I like very much.

When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk  
of her being pregnant.

During a football game I made an offence towards an acquaintance.  
Later on this acquaintance also tackeled me and the game became  
very rude.

When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to  
our favorite dancing.
Death of grandmother.

After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said  
all the wrong things.

At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and  
mostly at a philistinism.

About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some  
time ago.
When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.
I did badly in the mid term examination.
Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student.  
Because everything turned out different from my expectations.  
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a  
student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the  
beginning of September.

It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl  
but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized  
how painful this must have been for the girl.

A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that  
I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and  
scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.

One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the  
first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I  
requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did  
not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use  
against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.

Finding out about some girls who have been nice to the class  
leader in order to go to the neuropsychology lectures (English  
ones).

When I received a letter from the university telling me that my  
application had been accepted.

I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the  
floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the  
fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was  
involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.
Can't think of any.

When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was  
difficult to get out.
Having a good trip on a boat with good friends.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry  
examination.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant  
lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend  
myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my  
family.

When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I  
would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards  
me.

I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football  
match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was  
disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to  
UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.

My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an  
abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to  
do so.

I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current  
separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly  
(actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was  
drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather  
large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no  
one to help me).
Teacher suspected me stealing money.

When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it  
when asked about it later.
Not doing well in an examn which was easy.

When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerning  
something I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so I  
felt ashamed in front of the whole class.

I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College  
education.

I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would  
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

When I was involved in a car accident last November, after the  
first fall of snow.  I lost control of the car and it spun round  
and landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hard  
shoulder.  It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down  
to a stream.

During my Summer vacations I planned a carnival for the community  
youth center with a few other volunteers.  I was the head of the  
organizors and we spent over a month planning it.  During this  
period we got to know and understood each other.  We  
discovered each others potential and we planned many interesting  
things for the carnival.  The day of the carnival everything was  
bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.   
I felt extremely excited about it.
When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.

I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I  
did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a  
disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I  
discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was  
away. When I asked him he accepted it.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.

I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to  
thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what  
I had done and hurt that person and myself.

[ I have felt shame but am unable to remember any particular  
incident.]

I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English  
college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.
When I failed an exam.

As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I  
vomitted in the basin of the classroom.

A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went    
on holiday (I live in a collective).
Before examination.

On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty  
international. There I read (for the first time) a description of  
the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.
Listening to my roommate boasting about her new clothes.
After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.

When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died  
later.
I am scared when I stroll alone on the Chung Chi college campus.

Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street,  
sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only  
partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year    
old child I saw something horrible.

After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my  
father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father  
tried to put me and my sister against my mother revealing facts  
that had happened in the past like a talk between my father and  
his mother in law where she told him that my mother was not quite  
save.

When I saw a drunk man urinate upon himsellf and he seemed to be  
thoroughly content with it.

I made an appointment to pick up someone. However I arrived  
too late and she had to wait a quarter of an hour.
I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write  
Examinations in a few minutes.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational  
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and  
said that we were to blame.

I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I  
wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I  
wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started  
to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and  
felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold,  
and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.

Since I moved into the dorms and I've been spending most of my  
free time with my boyfriend. I hardly see my old high school  
friends. I had several bad incidents with my 2 past best friends.
A man spat on the wall of a house.
Love problems.
Meeting a male friend with whose wife I was having an affair.
When caught shop-lifting as for shame.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for  
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of  
childhood.

[ I feel shame when I do not arrive on time and others have to  
wait for me for a long time.]

Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from  
sleep.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his  
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could  
not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big  
surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our  
relationship grew closer.

When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of  
medical uniform.

I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten  
would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about  
something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the  
kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright  
till I got hold of her.

When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and  
their government was spending millions on celebrating being in  
power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing  
food, etc.

When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with  
violence. I was alone at home that moment.

The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a  
dead fly in my gravy.

When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and  
behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel  
personnel.

A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By  
concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was  
repressed in an identical way as he did before.
My parents failed to visit me as they promised.

When I did not concentrate on my studies despite my mother's help  
and cooperation.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

When I won the "Under 18" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The  
competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing.
When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.

Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain  
person, while that person is standing besides you and hears  
everything.
Some men were talking about me and my sister.

My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been  
seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with  
another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he  
had been doing behind her back.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5  
examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of  
acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling  
me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to  
dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.
The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had  
admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do  
it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be  
rebuked in front of the other pupils.

While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind  
me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation  
was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried  
to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and  
felt like crying.
I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.

I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and  
I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the  
group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I  
was with.

When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a  
terrible smell.
When I first had a sexual intercourse.
When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.

Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment that  
suits my taste, even though I had been told so.

I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences,  
after having spend two weeks there with my friends.
Before taking an exam.

When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before taking  
her exam.

Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when  
it had to be done.

Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the  
most important in my life.
When I saw a ghost.
I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.

When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and  
brought some flowers and cake with him.
When I swindled money out of someone.
When a friend died.

My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need to  
accomplish.

I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was  
very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".

When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the  
university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola  
secondary school.

When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them  
and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
The death of a close friend.

When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.   
He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible  
complex about it.

I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the  
bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to  
do.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.
The inability to read a book at college.

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close    
friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my  
application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had  
been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the  
list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was  
really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all  
day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the  
good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my  
studies.

When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just  
reason, and thus showed off his power.

I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was  
completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read  
about the subject matter.

I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was  
unable to go because of registration.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as  
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard  
to accept.

Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had to  
be breaking in. I called the police and was panicking while on  
the phone. It was awful. It turns out that I stepped on the  
hidden alarm without prior knowledge of its existance.

I dated another boy several times, when I was still "going with"  
my former boyfriend. This made me feel a little bit guilty towards  
my friend.

It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in  
the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends  
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable,  
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I  
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

When my father and I worked on the house just after he had  
recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he  
had to work hard and was not very well later.
Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.

When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks  
overtime.

When I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my  
relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of  
self pity.
Watching a horror film.
Almost had a bicycle accident.

One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and  
ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to  
visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.

There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very  
afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason  
of the incident.

When I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, when really it  
was 3.30.

During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave  
the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed  
and angry.

At an office an application that I had made was turned down  
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.

Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my  
brothers and sisters unfairly.

With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and  
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on her  
chemistry class. I pretended to be busy.

When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents  
were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had  
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father.  
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this  
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can  
happen in this world.

My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame  
bacause with her it is a stress disease.
I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and  
and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually  
not so important.

I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to  
be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with  
others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to  
come.

When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to  
stories about torturing people or animals.

When on Christmas day my grandmother died. I received the  
news when I was coming back from a party on the 24th at 5 am.

When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work  
expected of me was not going to be in.

When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the  
Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in  
TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not  
get the money.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.

Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions.  
Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was  
heading.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a  
University course.

I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played  
around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I  
took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of  
the foxtail.
My grandmother died during Christmas break several years ago.

A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the  
end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted  
marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.
I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.
Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
Thinking about other things in a lecture.
When I see rotten meat.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher,  
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
Nearly caught masturbating.

Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her  
down to other friends.

I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation:  
suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard  
that..."; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then  
everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".

I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the  
Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information  
was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the  
Headmaster.

It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my  
astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

The day the results of the certificate exam came out.  I went to  
school and at first I did not feel frightened.  By the time I  
reached the fourth floor ( the results were being given on the  
fifth floor) I found it difficult to walk and felt that I would  
die.

When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who  
made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about  
the killing of cows.

When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the  
college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity,  
and effort weren't corresponded.

A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once  
she had a child she had a better relationship with them.
Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.
My grandfather's funeral.

I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.  I waste my  
teacher's time and guidance.
When a girlfriend left me.

When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I  
thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of  
joy.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.

I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she told  
me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.

One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.   
I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not  
the servant but my daughter who had broken it.

I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't  
pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was  
very sad because it became a real quarrel.

When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it  
was killed by the dogs.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station,  
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I  
had a hard year ahead.
Falling off a cliff in the mountains.
Hearing a strange noise in the biology building.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my  
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to  
lose her.
My uncle died in the Vietnam War.

When a friend told me a story and I stayed dumb because I had no  
story to tell.
Passing a very difficult examination which I didn't expect - MCE.

I borrowed my classmate's notebook one week before the  
examination and I promised to give it back to her in two days  
time.  I was very busy at that time and forgot many things; as I  
was not very often at home she could not contact me.  When I  
started my revision I realized that her notebook had been on my  
desk for five days.  I contacted her immediately and gave it back  
to her.  Though she did not say anything I felt very guilty.

I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later  
than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid  
something might had happened, because usally he is in time.
Finding a hair in the soup.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and  
my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and  
ridiculous point of view made us angry.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we  
decided to be legally separated.
Before important sports events.

In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with  
several employers, after several years of dedication I was  
dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I  
heard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up from  
my dreams and it was about to crash me.

I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the  
bathroom on time.

The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my  
studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They  
believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something  
he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I  
had no idea what to answer.

A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at  
university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they  
ended up in court.
When others let me down, fail to keep agreements.

I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place but  
it took me an hour to find her.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
Being insulted in public.
When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When I crashed my car.

I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then,  
neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell  
him about the accident and I will never tell him.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had  
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced  
me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him  
for over an hour.
When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.

When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing  
going on in the world.

I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive  
Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was  
intending to leave the college.

When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the  
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have  
respect for anyone.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt  
so tense (studied too hard for an examination).
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These  
instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship  
which at the time seemed doomed to fail.

After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on  
I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.

When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a  
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.

Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on  
entering a government building with several people there.

I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc  
examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course  
thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.
I was very angry at someone.
When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
Hear people talking at my back.
I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate  
up the contents of another patient's spitoon.
When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.

The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed  
university subject was communicated to me by phone.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had  
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the          
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.
Shouting at my parents because I was angry about something else.

The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my  
uncle.
I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.

The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end  
of the semester at the University.

Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in  
love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with  
another boyfriend.

One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One  
of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty  
because it was me who took them there.

I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I  
was completely healthy.

When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous  
joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of  
worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.

When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my  
licence.
A pig in the well from which we drink.

A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on  
a great bald field.
When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.

As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate  
manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a  
school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic  
Students, so I felt very joyous.

When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had  
been very close and we would not be able to work with eachother  
any longer.
South Korea cheating for gold medals.
When mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.

While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she  
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the  
decisions concerning my life.

My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend  
himself very well; I should have taken his part.
A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.

When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with  
him. When I see again another I miss.
Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.

After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I  
started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want  
to see her anymore.

A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very  
disgusting, especially because I was eating.
Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.

I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as to  
why I could not go to visit them when they were ill.  When I did  
go, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible during 
their illness.

The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be  
alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this  
prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of  
the window.  They saw me.

I was working in I. when a friend of mine borrowed his car so I  
could get bach there, I had to come to S.Paulo and his car was  
here. He said :"When you get the car tell my mother that you are  
only taking the car bacause I asked, for she doesn't like me to  
borrow it". Next day he borrowed me it again for I had to come  
back again. When I was coming back I crashed the car quite a lot.  
One of the first person I met at the accident was his mother,  
that said to me "You weren't to take the car only yesterday ?"  
(before I saw her I was already ashamed).

When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee  
and I refuse to give him this.
I was called racial slurs behind my back.

This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely  
heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up  
one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never  
saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was  
"TRUE LOVE" !!

Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and  
cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a  
few days.

In school I was very bad in running long distances and my  
class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their  
too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left  
them to the mercy of fate.

When one of my best friends commited siucide during these  
holidays.

In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body  
and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected.  
Few people could come near him.
The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but  
through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits  
of a good driver.
When my mother died.

Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation.  
He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he  
had achieved this position.

A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act  
as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an  
hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not  
want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only  
was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I  
would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.
When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.

I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips  
and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a  
cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat  
it.

Last year my freshman yr. It was a day in March I did well on  
some tests. I seemed to finally adjust to college, it was hot and  
sunny. I was walking in front of a frat. when I heard Beach Boys  
"Surfin'USA". I had this overwhelming feeling that to be at CAL  
was good. I still have it somewhat.

[ I can not remember anything in particular.  What I can remember  
is feelings of having done or said something which then had  
negative consequences.]
When a close friend did not write.
When I was just to be divorced.

I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of  
the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they  
called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do  
about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).   
Then I got angry.

I was talking with an aunt of mine that I adore and I found  
courage to say "I love you" and just after that came the shame.

One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.   
I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.

When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the  
ticket.

It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared  
for the training at Military college when he was coming back from  
his personal social activities.

One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her  
boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to  
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole  
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and  
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I  
wouldn't see many of them again.
I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an  
examination.
When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's  
reaction to the students demands concerning the educational  
system.

The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close  
to me.(blaming us and lying)
When I read racist slogans on the walls.

I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the  
bus.

When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean  
tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do  
with football.

I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stop  
going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14  
years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.

At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric  
measurements, I made a mistake, and didn't buy enough tiles for  
the bathroom. I was angry at myself, because I hope to be a Maths  
teacher.

Once when I had started to write a paper, there was a phone  
call for me.  I had to go downstairs to receive it and after the  
conversation I discovered that all the information had  
disappeared from my mind.
When my grandmother died.

My friend had organized a birthday party for me secretly, I was  
very happy not so much for the presents but because they seemed  
to care for me.

Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV  
dealer.
Having told a certain lie.
When my uncle died.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have  
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went  
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great  
the distance between us was.
I got a job right after school was over.

I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the  
forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear  
noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
Talking about snakes.

When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a  
particularly trying period.
I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway  
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I  
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are  
perhaps dead.
My best friend chosen for your English lectures.
Saw a father beating up his small child.
Saw some young people fighting for seats on a bus.

When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seen  
her for 4 months.

I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her  
for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby  
where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband  
would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.

When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic  
magazine.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.

I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being  
treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been  
there.

On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought  
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.
Not getting a job.

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me  
verbally.

I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick  
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars  
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on  
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.
A boy in my class talking too loud in the lecture.

When I had broken a piece of glass of the refrigerator by putting  
a hot pan in it.
Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.
When a person that I like very much got near to me.

When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the  
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher"  
and came from influential families.

When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the  
first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my  
first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.

When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to  
accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was  
directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We  
were with a marriage counsellor then.

I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was  
finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I  
accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're  
paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said  
to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut  
me off financially and emotionally.

My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and  
suffered an aphasia.
When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.

When my dad told me about something he had done against my  
mother.

When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a  
friend of mine.
A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

When the teacher asked me to read my composition that was the  
homework I stood up and invented one because I hadn't done it. A  
colleague saw that in my copy book there was nothing written and  
he accused me and so I was called in the director's room.

It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whom  
I have frequent relationships but nothing special.

When my oldest sister discovered that her boyfriend had another  
girl.

Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the  
road. Broke an arm, only.

Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for  
pharmacy completed.

I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military  
base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want  
to be caught.

After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he  
walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I  
became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday,  
November 14.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being  
procrastinated.

The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving  
Certificate Examinations.

Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are  
non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
Going to CAL not knowing anyone.

I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who  
needed it immediately.
My sister bkoke her leg.

I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I  
had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by  
a group of louts.
When I saw a horror film.
When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.
I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had  
been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

I felt very disgusted at a friend to whom I had given a Psychology  
book to read, and she did not care to give me back the book  
during the exams.

When people manipulate others through appearing better than what  
they really are.
Ran into a parking car on a bicycle.

When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family  
members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was  
already 80 years old.

Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for  
years.
I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.

In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic  
Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell  
that only a few people .... the place.
When my brother died.

I felt very guilty when a student, sitting in front of me in the  
exam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers,  
 though I knew them.
Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly  
intead of being criticized by the teacher.
When I had my four children.

After making an effort to enter at University I found a course  
and a school of higher education which were compatible with my  
experience and potentiality.

Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself  
and never acting positively to do something about her problems.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel I  
need to study and doesn't understand how important studying is to  
me. I get very angry with her.
I stopped working (had a boring job).
When my mother surprised me while masturbating.
Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.
A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.

I felt guilty when I learnt that some of friends found the  
finished at the Cafeteria because I took food which was more than  
my share.
China winning the Asian Olympic games (TV).

Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close   
relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of being  
inconsiderate in my relationship with them.

At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a  
friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally  
ill.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder  
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or  
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of  
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very  
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me  
from the inst.
Damaged the tap in the residental Hall.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him  
and and my Easter holidays.

A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential  
matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours.  
 When this common friend told me the version my friend had told  
her, I was angry.

A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a  
concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the  
way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning  
in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her  
at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the  
death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I  
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not  
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it  
carelessly and it broke.

I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was  
eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned  
him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took  
out his chair I knocked down my own glass.
When I passed an important exam.
The death of my grandmother.

I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there were  
not too many people on the street.  A couple of guys were  
following me and I was ignoring them.  Suddenly one of them came  
in front of me and started using dirty language and harrassing  
me.  I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.
My grandmother died.

When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply  
because it was far away from my house.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.

When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas'  
Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she  
said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a  
light had to be left turned on.

On Christmas eve,1984, I had just finished the exams and was  
afraid as the results of one of my major subjects had been very  
unsatisfactory.  I thought that I had only a 50% chance of  
passing.  Even if I failed this subject I would not need to  
repeat.  However I liked this subject very much and my results  
were bad because of my lazyness.  If I was forced to change to a  
minor in this subject I would be very unwilling.

It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my  
M.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of the  
event.
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

Calling lecturers nicknames when talking to housemen (They told  
ne you are even younger than they are so you should not be giving  
public lectures).

[ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little  
sister.]

Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army  
location.

A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with their  
class. When they were back home I heard people tell "strange"  
stories about my friend and that girlfriend.

I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my  
brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

I often feel guilty, and it has to do with other people, e.g. if  
I haven't visited my older relatives for a while.

I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't  
study for Anatomy class on Monday.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is  
not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was  
very afraid so that I will never forget it.

About the girl (22 years, married) I felt guilty of the  
relationship.

When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and  
that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.
When my mother interfered in my life.
Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.

I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in the  
presence of my boyfriend.
Finding out that China is backward in science.

When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start  
studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the  
part II exam.
When I could not fulfill my expectations.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
Going to the examn not well prepared.

When I read about or think about environmental pollution, the  
armor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind is  
bad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature and  
mankind.

A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (four  
to eight years of age).

When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school  
with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the  
school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two  
kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering  
how I would get back home.

I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear  
friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.
I cheated my boyfriend.

I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to  
our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved  
him very much.
I won the country ski championship.
My mother in law slept in my bed.

My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my  
mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't  
tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.
I got caught shoplifting a package of gummy bears.

My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He  
kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not  
listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I  
ended up in tears - he'd won.
When I entered a bar looking for a friend.

When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents,  
brothers and sisters.
Being sexually assulted in public.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form  
another unit. The reason was girls.

I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture  
of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine  
took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some  
unnecessary work.
Lack of respect for my parents.

When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of  
getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the  
job.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and  
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.   
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.

An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give  
me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

I was very angry when my friend lost my practical's journal,  
which I needed to study for the exams.

When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions  
people are attended there.
Every time I do not write something well in English.

There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the  
courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then  
opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the  
seat.

I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My  
original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have  
to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is  
real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in  
Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am  
not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication  
and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are  
the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.

When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my  
girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a  
policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the  
children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were  
made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my  
room by my father.

I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family  
got to know about it, this was just when I had become a  
Christian.

When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full  
of cockroaches.
When I offend somebody unfairly.
After lot of explanation, to fail in my work.

When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for.   
This was disclosed later.

My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this  
because she always talks negatively about the same people  
whatever I do it doesn't help.

During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his  
girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my  
brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place  
for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I  
had never asked her.
I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.
When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbors.

First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best  
friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved  
emotionally.

My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he  
could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I  
could not but detest him.

My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were  
not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him  
because a similar situation happened to me.
When a girl left me.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be  
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
I had a car accident.
Was caught stealing apples in a neighbor's garden.

I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not  
paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.

In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers.  
Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to  
priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).

When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard  
about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really  
became conscious of her death at that moment.

I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and  
my best possessions got burnt in there.

At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is  
not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had  
observed that.
When I was at school.
None.
[ Can not think of anything just now.]

When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns would  
send back the people who came to visit us when it was not the  
visiting hours.  This disgusted me.

A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him  
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.

Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called  
"treatment" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II.

I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked  
simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there  
was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just  
playing with my friends.

I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we   
started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started  
teasing me.

In 1983, my results at the university entrance exam were very  
poor - far from what I had expected.   I thought that I would not  
be accepted at the university.
When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.

In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship,  
died.

When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in  
the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members  
were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study  
further.

I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to  
her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they  
foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.   
An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.
When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of  
darkness when going home.

The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army  
was really mean.  I detested this.
When I had passed MCE examinations.

A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had  
tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I  
told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling  
depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of  
confidentiality.
A woman picked her nose and spit right next to me.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.

When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the  
washing.
Saw a blue film in a cinema.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated  
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite  
undeservedly.
When I have a plain appearance.

Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family  
friends dinner. Told "Not to Speak". The attitude by him was  
negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range  
of experiences. Probably greater than he.

New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the  
steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the  
first time.

I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He  
ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his  
"doormat".
When I was fined for speeding.

Whenever I see poverty and starvation. I live in an affluent  
society and am privileged to have many opportunities.

When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had  
actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting  
me.

I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town)  
when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would  
not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road  
and hurried home.

When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good"  
high school graduation marks.

When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital  
cricket match.

As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned  
for guilt.

I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A  
few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told  
her that I had no idea.
When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me  
afraid.
Punished by a leader.

I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my  
sadness was so great that until today I remember everything  
about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people,  
the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was  
the greatest sadness I felt.
Falling in love although she is my friend (angry with myself).
Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games  
with a friend.

I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school  
due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know  
what he had to do.

The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's  
eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.

I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go,  
I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.

When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back  
home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.
When I quarelled with my parents.

At a school dance when my supposed "best friend" kept walking  
away from me whenever I came near her.

My roommate refused to walk with me to the English lectures. I  
have to walk alone in the dark. Lectures are in the biology  
building.

[ This is an everyday feeling.  Many situational events : causes  
are unclean and dirty environment, illiteracy, poverty and  
neglect of human resources, disgust at the lack of perception on  
the part of us ( educated few) for the lack of drive and drive  
towards their redemption. ]

As a young girl in form I, I wet my bed one day at the boarding  
school and many girls came to see the person who had done it as I  
had to take my mattress out that day.
When I did not go to work because I had to study for a midterm.

Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this  
I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful  
moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.
When I got separated from the man I loved so much.
Saw someone licking his dining bowl.

My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought  
back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend  
thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told  
me that the change was not correct.

One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was  
(mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me.

When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call  
from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and  
wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and  
especially when I saw her.

When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for  
a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to  
bath.

When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut  
to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which  
impressed me most.
Not handing in homeworks in time.
A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium  
(the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the  
crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had  
to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole  
town !
Relative's death.
When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and  
torture.

A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be a  
slimy fellow towards a professor.

When an employer of my younger sister (17 yrs) made a "pass" at  
her.

After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination  
and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.

After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to  
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a  
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his  
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being  
robbed in Marocco.
At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and  
had not had time alone together for almost a month until one  
afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered  
and ate together.

I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.   
The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I  
was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot  
to leave a tip.

When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and the  
illness was not known.

I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last  
week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.

I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept       
on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect  
me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.
I felt guilty when I lost K43 for my friend when he was arrested.
I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately  
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.
When I get a hug from someone I love.

When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it  
I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for  
not having the time to write a good essay.

Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening  
around me which pleases me.

I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of my  
jr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolwork  
and who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older and  
more successful than they were. At the time I pictured some  
adults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him,  
provoked her and just utilized her.

I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful  
in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was  
selected for Secondary School.

I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned  
my sister out of my parents home.
When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.
When I got low marks in B.Sc final.

We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver  
tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck  
parked right in front.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried  
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling  
his body.

When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people  
stood around the open grave and cried.

I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the  
student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the  
work.
Finding out that China is still backward in science.
A father helping his kid to fight other kids.

Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument  
because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.
Article published.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.

I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined  
us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in  
shame without knowing where to go from there.
