Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a  
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had  
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my  
daughter.

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every  
time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

I was going around with a girl without loving her.  Not only did  
I go around with her, but we did many more things.  In the end I  
was not very sincere to her.

When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a  
friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I  
was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in  
spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me  
(sort of incorporation !).
Can't remember any episode of disgust.

A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a  
wedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car when  
home took quite a while.
When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.

When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it  
wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl  
take vacations that month. The anger was because of the  
resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.

A friend of mine had sex with someone of a different race on a  
Winnebago trip down to USC in front of everyone (all my friends  
embarrassed my sorority house name).

My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening,  
when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's  
expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support  
me and I began to weep convulsively.
A typical family argument.

As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a  
neighbour.

When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and  
caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.

On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself  
and got to know many other people.

I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with  
handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.
When I got very drunk and really misbehaved at Christmas.
I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.

Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings  
and into a situation of loneliness.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a  
dictation.

The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in  
exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.
When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.

One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had come  
back for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstore  
and ate all internal organs of the chicken. When mother  
discovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stained  
with soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.
When my B.A results had not come.
When I woke up after a nightmare.
I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no  
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The  
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be  
announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results  
were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.

I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.  I had tried to  
hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in  
the kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered the  
stolen package.
Insulting other people.
Saying goodbye to a friend.

I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He  
was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper.  
Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was  
retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate  
with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for  
pouring his soup.
Finding out that I am not ill (not seriously).

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I  
kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I  
promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after  
a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate  
had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor  
caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and  
it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter  
for him to be caught.

I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very  
cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought.  
 I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed  
at myself as a lot of people I know were there.
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.

When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress  
myself and was examined by several doctors.

I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some  
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry   
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
Not getting the reference paper.

Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walked  
out of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me when  
I went to find her.
I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
When I first passed a job interview.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
When I fought with my friends.

When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually  
and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up  
to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was  
forced to hide this for a while.

Knowing that I had to do the survey with him I felt very  
reluctant.  Although I do not know him I feel disgusted by just  
looking at him.  Thinking that the project lasted several days I  
regreted having joined that project.

One day while we were strolling along the road one of my  
friends suggested that we go and watch a blue film.  I was  
curious so I went along but I felt quite guilty later.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all  
lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only  
English classes)
I took an exam which I failed terribly as I had not studied.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
When my grandmother died after a long illness.
Facing a mad dog.

I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who  
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short  
illness.
When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).
When going to the exam.

I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date   
with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was  
afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved  
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything  
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).

My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a  
good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.   
Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to  
defend my friend.
When I was insulted by a man.

On New Years eve I drank too much alcohol, so much that I had to  
vomit in the presence of other people.

When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my  
mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward  
factors.

When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to  
back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only  
about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.
When someone took my pen away.

I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home  
in Woodlands.

When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could  
be freed only with big difficulties.
Saw poverty in the countryside.
The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.

The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the  
moment of dying I was with her.

My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had  
been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after  
I had already parked.

One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that  
some of my relatives had died in an accident.

When I was teaching a student started making silly remarks in  
class.

One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was  
supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home  
telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a  
history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my  
third year of my Secondary School.
To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.

I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in  
somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court.  
I went to see what would happen to him.

At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little  
brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined  
creepy men sneaking into our house.

I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students  
during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker  
and caused great conflicts with the teachers.
When I was coming back home alone at night.

When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and       
still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never  
happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I  
feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious   
all night.

It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a  
present together. However, now I had bought something together  
with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.

Yesterday while playing volley ball, there was one person extra     
and somebody had to out.  A mess worker and I were the   
last ones to arrive and we had arrived at the same time.   
Rightfully one of us had to opt out of the game, as I was  
delaying leaving the mess worker opted out saying that I should  
play.  I felt ashamed of myself.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last  
born in the family.

When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to  
prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at  
last that she would not turn up.

My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medical  
examinations we did not know what would follow.

My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral  
hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is  
always the threat to loose her.
My father left us for another woman.

A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because  
she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed  
money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
When I sit for examinations.

Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had  
worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.

After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling  
of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to  
turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I  
was able to get to sleep again.

When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to  
let me go.

When a friend from whom I preferred to hide my private life  
discovered that I had relations with a man.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in  
the children Assembly.

I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I  
was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish  
that training.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and  
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately  
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male  
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart  
for all her life.

One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something  
inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some  
weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work  
standards.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had  
previously failed.

A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, but  
something came up and I cancelled out on him.

When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered  
things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had  
not mentioned it earlier.

A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar  
terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no  
reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I  
would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever  
cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to  
learn that it was me who was delaying things.

Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust  
that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

Being refused to attend the neuropsychology lecture in the  
medical university.

My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy  
upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.

When my Bictorian "friend" was staying at my house we ere going  
places together, and sleeping together. At the time I had a  
boyfriend locally. The first time I had to face him after  
sleeping with the guy from Melbourne I felt very guilty.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life  
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.
After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing  
it.
Seeing maltreated, dead animals.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right  
into the court.
A grenade blew out next to me.

It was spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it.
 The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed  
in over my head.
My first kiss.
Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

I rejected a person whom I had always thought to be a friend.  I  
told him so and he reacted angrily.  I felt guilty at not having  
realized it before and at having hurt him.

I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a  
fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was  
told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very  
young.

That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was  
cought.

When I state things with great positiveness and try to convince  
others, and it appears that my statement is not right.
When I failed the M.S.C exam.

It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home  
telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend  
the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already  
taken place.

A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip  
of whimsy.

This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I  
kept in the cupboard.

I feel anger when I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child  
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national  
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish  
referee who ran the match quite partially.

There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw  
paw-paw in the face.

When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss  
them.

It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was  
taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal  
pains.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but  
I am alone.

I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met  
someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my  
self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to  
myself.

I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence  
and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed  
that they would come for me any time.

I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that  
I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health  
Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and  
threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money.  
 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.
When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.

When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo  
an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation  
succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.

Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in  
communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only  
wanted 50 g).

When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into  
another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the  
other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt  
guilty.

I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one  
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion  
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my  
reason.

The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had  
left open.

On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself  
upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in  
the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.

When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not  
democratic.

My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live  
in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.

I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was  
probably an imposter.

At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed  
eachothers company, while slow dacing.
I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.

Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a  
few days before and then one morning it was gone.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed     
at every menstruation.

Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how  
angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he  
would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking.  
But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially  
since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.
Someone being arrogant to me.

When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in  
the career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.

I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like  
normal people.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by  
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

When I received my S.Y.J.C results which did not allow me to get    
admission in engineering.

In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  
 One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk  
(hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and  
I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my  
ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without  
harming her.

I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although  
they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
When I first saw a person begging.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of  
mine.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a  
small Lazer).

The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a  
close friend of mine.

Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to  
cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude  
problem.
When my grandfather died.
I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for  
the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for  
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
When I copy someone else's problem set.

I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of  
pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a  
classroom at P.V.C.
When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.

I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again,  
although she had asked me to do so.

I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text  
and didn't stop stuttering.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short  
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt  
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought  
the cloth after months of hindrances.

When I got the midterm exam results, the results were below  
average and were near the lowest.  I was scared of the final  
exam.

This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I  
(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in  
and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months  
later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel  
guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for  
myself and my future.

Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as  
rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no  
good.
I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.
When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.

I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful  
scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus  
the picnic was worthwhile.

When I was studying in the library a pair of lovers were sitting  
next to me talking in an intense and soft voice.  They were  
disturbing others.

When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during the  
birthday of my girlfriend.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my  
Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and  
didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted  
at 14.
My grandmother died.

When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had  
told him that my father had retired.

My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was  
my sister who had done it.

A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly  
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.

There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who  
were acquaintances.  It should have been picked up a year ago but  
they had postponed it.  Eventually they decided on one date and I  
stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do.   
They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got  
in touch with me.

When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that  
the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead  
of listening, I become angry.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in  
February.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;  
blood was dripping on the floor.

A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in a  
car accident.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.
Saw people quarreling in a bus.

I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my  
exams.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where  
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't  
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the  
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow  
light.
